column5: How dare you let your staff go home at 10pm on NYE when people need food! I m disgusted! You should chain your staff to the tills and never let them leave!
Love your glitter paper used it for 2 years now. Please don t let the haters win and bring it back next year x

What s your return policy on faulty goods?   Bought 2 2ds consoles back in October for Christmas so obviously they ve been in use for a week now and one seems to have just broke it s not charging or turning on I no longer have the box unfortunately so don t really know what to do

Went to your store in St Katherines at 21.50 tonight as I m staying in the tower hotel needed to get my three year old some food for the morning but was told by a security guard in a rude way that it was closed even tho i pointed out the sign that said 10pmclosing  i asked for the manager but was told the security guard was th manager tonight. Wont use you lot again aftet this  I am a loyal customer and on new years eve when I thought I would treat my family I get this treatment.

Would like to say a big thank you to the staff at Tesco in Irvine  North Ayrshire for their help today. My daughter fell and split her head open while I was at the checkout. The staff were there in an instant to help  they gave us an ice pack  they also gave my daughter a sticker book to keep her occuiped while the first aider had a look at her and then they even helped me out to my car. Huge thanks to everyone involved. üòç

As a customer for a number of years I am disgusted that having ordered food for this evening for delivery I have not had a phone call to say your not bothering - having ordered this two weeks ago! So I have had to nip to Sainsbury s for dinner and have nothing now for next week or tomorrow #newyearspoilt #tesco #everylittlehelps
Hi  I have quite a few receipts (4 or 5 months old) which needs to be added to my Clubcard. Please let me know how to do it?

I have just checked my Lloyds bank and found that Tesco bank have taken  a payment for car insurance. I did not renew my car insurance with Tesco as the quote was far too expensive. I have tried the  phone numbers and say they are now closed. My car insurance reference number is 3136435V. I wish for you to return the money taken out of my Lloyds bank account ASAP as the insurance period started 00.01 hours 01-01-2017

What an absolute joke all these tesco closed tonight. How dare they close so their staff can see 2017 in with their  friends  family  and loved ones. Now me and my pal chardonnay  will have to go without our  bottle of Lambrini.

Dear Tesco  I braved one of your stores today for some NYE supplies  the main element of which was party poppers. Now  I feel that the clue is in the name and that this product should indeed  pop.  My 5 year old Son  hanging eagerly from the string of the first one  pulled....... and the string came off in his hand. The only  pop  evident was the sound of his little  hopeful heart breaking. We tried another 4 times and the same thing happened. At ¬£3.50 I was reluctant to purchase them anyway  being that they would simply be money  literally  burnt. But knowing that my children find them an integral part of New Year s Eve  I purchased them.   Tesco  I now fear that our midnight celebrations will be  damp  or at least premature as we will have to manually burst the party poppers and unravel the cheap paper insides ourselves.   I ve endured many a disappointing bang in my lifetime but now you re messing with my kids and I have to draw the line at that.   We will start prepping for midnight at 11:45 due to the terrible quality of your party poppers. I hope you can live with yourselves.   Unpopped  Gosport.
My online delivery is missing all from the fridge section = annoying = no dinner. Please DM me your solution. Cheers
What time does tesco marlborough shut tonight please

Just for the record  I loved your glitter wrapping paper. It was obvious it was real glitter  people shouldn t purchase if they don t like glitter. It gave me great pleasure to wrap gifts in this sparkly way with matching ribbon and bows. üòÄ

For Christmas we decided to go abroad   come back and have a Christmas dinner with all our family . I went to Tesco in Hollington to get a large leg of lamb . Sold out so I got two lamb joints   as I was cooking for 15 people .. I cooked for the 2hours   uncovered and cooked for a further 30 minutes . While it was cooling   I prepared the rest of the meal . We started to calve the meat   which in actual fact was pure fat !!! There was no meat on either joints  just thick fat running through the whole joint . My partner had to rush back up Tesco and buy 2 cooked chickens . I d already made a lamb gravy with onion and red wine so we had to use that with chicken . Very very disappointed . Ended up paying ¬£24 for all the meat . And the chicken barely went round . I m only thankful that u were open for me to get more supplies . I will never buy your lamb joints again !

come on Tesco get your act together.....I went into local store today to collect a click n collect order...the place was very busy as to be expected on new years eve afternoon but our collect point is upstairs in the clothing dept.....there was one poor lady on the tills.a queue of at least 12 people and a lot of  staff members   walking around try ing to look busy...fair enough  they were dressed in black so guess they were  clothing   staff but there was no one else to help out on tills she looked like she wanted to cry...whats happened to tesco policy of opening another till?????????????its always the same in that dept only ever 1 till on and the whole of upstairs to serve....20 mins for me to get served today...........:-(

Just received ¬£85 parking penalty from Parking eye who  manage  Tesco car park where I shop regularly. I went there twice within 12 hours and it only recorded my entrance on the first occasion and my departure on the second. Surely they can afford more sophisticated technology than this. Word of warning: do not shop at Tesco more than once in a 24 hour period or the parking Cowboys will say you ve stayed all day!
Why is your south tidworth branch putting Easter eggs out in December... do you plan on putting Halloween stuff out too?
Your website store locator is broken! Is Bristol Eastville open tomorrow?

Well just wanted to say a massive thankyou to your customer service staff in tesco broughton. On Thursday 22nd Dec I was rushing round doing my Xmas food shop (10pm) when I walked past a cage in one of the aisles. The cage ripped my brand new coat on the sleeve and I was gutted. I mentioned it to the staff member who was emptying the cage who told me to go and speak to customer service. Which I did  and was told straight away without hesitation that it would be sorted. I was advised to buy a replacement coat or bring the original receipt in  for my coat. I went away feeling annoyed and stressed as I had so much other stuff to do for Xmas. Anyway  today I received my replacement coat that I ordered on line and went into store to speak to customer service. Straight away they said told me that I would get the full amount that I paid for my replacement without hesitation.  Thankyou so much tesco... You have made me very happy x
Just wanted to pass my thanks onto the driver who delivered my shopping this afternoon. Excellent service and was really friendly.   He was on Route 6X from Telford Retail Park Store.

Just been in Tesco and was very thirsty so thought I d buy a bottle of water. While I was drinking it someone knocked into me causing it spill over me. I was shocked at how wet it was . You should really put a caution on the bottle that this water is wet
Don t buy halal chicken they have been boiling them to death  come on Tesco stop all orders now. Take the lead for human treatment of these birds.

Went to tesco at Falkirk retail park today. Wanted bread and potatoes mainly. Imagine my surprise to find that the only potable they had were baking potatoes or the tiny packs of Charlotte potatoes  or similar. No 2.5 kg bags of basic spuds. Asked the guy I found stacking potatoes  wasn t interested  just said they didn t have any. Found another guy who was more helpful who said that the order had been  messed up  and that they had ran out!  Fancy running out of a staple like potatoes! Tesco  you re a shambles! I could understand you running out of steak pies at this time of year  but potatoes?!  Needless to say I had to source them from somewhere else.  Not impressed at all. üò°üò°

Awful experience with the Scan as you shop at Tesco York. 2 items away from finishing our fortnightly shop and the scanner died. Huge credit to Caroline for trying everything she could to revive it but ultimately have had to rescan the whole shop - most frustrating  particularly with an over-tired toddler in tow. Surely the battery life on the handsets should be sufficient to complete an average shop  but apparently this is an all-too-common occurrence. Not impressed.
Does anyone know the cooking temperature and time for TESCO freshly made Pizza please? Seems that they don t get put on them anymore üò°üò¢ xx

Hi  I purchased 2 of these Dairy Milk Freddo selection boxes over Christmas at my local store. The added bonus it has a promotion  Free Child Entry  to Cadbury World  which I planned to do in 2017 with my children. I have just cut the vouchers out to keep them safe  and they were out of date in April 2016!!  Luckily the chocolate isnt out of date until April 2017  but still doesnt make me too happy that its probably been hanging around in a warehouse since last Christmas. Plus it is advertising an offer which was long out of date. I am all for preventing waste  but at the same time  many people could purchase them and be disappointed. Thanks  Lorna

As a regular Tesco customer I have to say how disgusted I am at the quality of the vegetables not just in one but three of your stores in the lead up to Xmas and up to the new year.  I have seen veg that had gone brown  so manky it had juice collecting in the wrapping and products on the shelves today which had a use by date of today !  This is totally unacceptable.  Also to add further insult to injury I have used scan and pay and every time I ve done it we have been Picked for a random check (so random it s us all the time ) and the staff don t care how they turn your trifle upside down üò°üò°üò°üò°happy new year Tesco because I am changing my retailer in 2017.  At least 3-4 other people I know also said how rubbish your veg has  been and they shop in different areas .
Thanks Tesco for my substitution s in today s delivery. Ordered Gluten Free party food and had gluten delivered. Just love it. Guess I won t be joining the party this year!

I too have that awful wrapping paper that NOTHING sticks to....had to go to the expense of buying gift bags as I ran out of time to get other wrapping paper! What do you suggest I do with the rolls I still haven t? Absolute waste of my time. üò°

Dear Tesco  So i bought some craft glitter to jazz up a pair of shoes  OMG its everywhere  my hair  my face my clothes   my dining table looks like  an army of fairys got tipsy n spilt their dust everywhere.  OMG who would of guessed it would bring so much laughter as my mate says my face looks like a disco every time i move my head. Thanks for the laughs Tesco  looking forward to the second coat when this one dries  Happy New Year. Me sarcastic??  Never LOL.

So today there was a issue with my home delivery I contacted tesco and was told there was nothing else that could be done resulting in all my stuff for tonight s party not being delivered ..... they passed me onto roborough store and I spoke to a gentleman called Craig.... I have to say he was fantastic and resolved the issue for me  a lovely delivery guy drop it all off within 20minutes of calling... please can you pass my regards onto the guys that dealt with it today! Yh you guys so much! Happy new year to you all üòòüòòüòòüòòüòò

I have just been to my local Tesco to purchase my favourite Hommous from the kosher line...couldn t find it....turns out it s been discontinued from production üò≠üò¢üò£ why tesco? Why? Please bring it back!!

Just like to say  we are pleased we got the delivery saver earlier this year as its been such a help to getting my shopping delivered. It also helped us get a slot booked for xmas delivery which came in handy as I dont drive and hubby had an eye operation and wasnt allowed to drive for 2 weeks  thanks to all the staff who picked my shopping at the Workington store and the delivery drivers who brought it home for me  Happy New Year.
Excellent customer service in Yate store today from Juliette and Ryan  a credit to your company!

Dear Mr Tesco    I would like to thank you for your shocking policy regarding tablets   I had one purchased for my son from your store   upon opening for Christmas is was found to have a large crack down the middle. On returning the product I am informed a crack is accidental damage regardless of whether it was like it when I bought it or not . So baclsically when a customer purchases this item they have to take it out and inspect at the time of purchase ot you pretty much are calling me a liar  as a staff memeber did .or as I was advised on the phone    whoever bought the gift should just buy another one      because we all have 70 -100 quid laying about to do so  Merry Conmas Tesco

Why is it tesco always seem to try and fleece their customers??   For about 2 years I ve enjoyed the same meal once a week....   Tesco CHUNKY Breaded cod fillets. Pack of 4. 500g ¬£2.75  But oh tesco what a disappointment... Tesco breaded cod fillets. Pack of 4  500g ¬£2.00  So for the last 2 years you ve mugged me and my family off 75p a week. I buy what I think is the bigger product based on the fact it s apparently chunkier  so if it s the same weight how can you class it as  chunky  and charge almost another 40%?   That s about 75 quid wasted over the space of 2 years. Sure... Every little helps. I think not!!   We as consumers shouldn t have to check weights or prices on something that s advertised as bigger/chunkier. Shouldn t tesco try and make  every little help ??
stop buying boiled halal chickens show you have the courage to do this before profit  do it today ste an example to all supermarkets

What happened to price matching like for like on your home deliveries? I ordered two boxes of Tesco cold tablets (total ¬£1.30) but as you presumably didn t have them  you instead sent me 1 box of Beechams for ¬£1.30. Hardly a fair swap when they re exactly the same ingredients  so now I m short of half the tablets I ordered for the same price. Careful Tesco or people will start confusing you with Asda with your poor substitutions!
I just tried opening a bottle of Tesco prosecco and bottle has cracked in half and sliced my hand

TESCO NEW SQUARE - WEST BROMWICH If a Manager called Tanya takes staff away from their place of work mid order  can you make sure you give them time to let the other person coming know what s they are doing!! Over 20 minutes I waited for my Pizza and it hadn t even been done because you didn t allow  communication  between your team - BAD DRILLS üò°üò° xx

I am writing to express my sincere disappointment in Tesco s. I saw a Windows based tablet advertise on their website for ¬£49. I live 200 meters from Tesco so I decided to go in and get one only to be told if I bought it directly from the store it would cost me ¬£89. I haven t heard anything so ridiculous in all my life. Just wait till Martin Lewis hears about this. I ordered the item online from the same store and they give me the option to collect free of charge. Can you believe this????

Just wondering why i can purchase something online and get it delivered to my nearest store it s cheaper than just going to the store today and getting it? I wanted to purchase the hydra coach bottle which online is ¬£10 but in my local super market it is ¬£20. I would have preferred it today but would rather not pay an extra ¬£10 for that pleasure. The staff are just going to take the same one off the shelf and sit it at the collection bay for me  so why couldn t I just purchase it in store today for the lower amount?
Thanks Tesco  . You cancelled my order then didn t give me my money back this was on 16th Dec. Still not gone back on . Rating -100
I ve just opened 3 of your tomato juices and every one of them had the internal seal broken! Not very happy about this!

I seem to be having issues getting through to your customer service but over the Xmas I popped into tesco to grab some essentials and picked up some nappies for my 20month old. Since putting them on her she has suffered terrible nappy rash so bad that the skin has actually broken and she screams every time she goes to the toilet now have 2 packets of nappies that I can t do anything with and have had to spend more money replacing them!

Hi Tesco      Normally i am pretty good at doing the shopping lol but in the early hours of 23rd of december i managed to leave a cd in the trolly and when i phoned up later it had been handed in and customer services had already and waiting for me so many thanks to the Harford road norwich store for helping me out

I personally love glitter! All this anger about the wrapping paper - I had presents from friends in this paper and loved it! It was certainly a giggle covering the men in the house with glitter as they don t have the tools (i.e. A bottle of micellar and a cotton pad) to remove it! Christmas is surely the time to make a giggle out of any situation! üòÇ

Hello  just made a breakfast sandwich for me and my friend and was struggling to work out why you put 7 rashers of bacon in each pack? Either we have 3 each then there is one left over which is useless  or someone gets more than the other and that s not fair on either of us.   I can imagine this is only handy if you are a spinster who does a weekly shop and only eats one slice of bacon a day.   Either put 6 or 8 in I reckon.   Suppose I could just buy a pack of 14? More profit for you. I see what you did there.

On 27/12/16 I took my mum to the St Helens Extra tesco (she was staying with me over Christmas). The cost came to ¬£89.79. She had 2 full cards of saving stamps - so ¬£100 with which to pay. The young lad didn t know how to do it (? seasonal staff)  so asked for help from the girl behind. She explained how to do it but then said that if we used both cards we wouldn t get any change!  Due to a growing queue behind us we didn t feel that we could argue  so just handed one card over  along with ¬£34.50 of vouchers (which didn t need to be spent until November 2017) and then paid the difference (¬£4.71) in cash. I suggested going to customer service to check that the information about not getting change from unused stamps was correct but there was also a queue there. On 30/12/16  my mum went to the Widnes Extra store (her local store) and handed over the other card with ¬£50 of stamps on and was given change with no problem.  We are both annoyed that we had to use ¬£34.50 of vouchers and cash that we didn t need to use. Can you confirm who was correct - the staff in the St Helens store or the staff in the Widnes store and maybe ensure that ALL staff in ALL stores are aware of the correct protocol too?
Many  many thanks to the staff of Tesco Petersfield who found and kept safe my travel neck-support pillow. I don t think that they still sell that one; it s very important to me.

Tesco I am absolutely shocked that with my shopping that has just been delivered (about an hour ago) that the Free from yogurts that I ordered for my son with several allergies and intolerances are out of date! I thought that the people who pick the shopping are meant to check the dates on items and inform you if there is a short date and shouldn t be sold if out of date! I would like someone to contact me to resolve this issue asap. Thanks

Home delivery order didn t turn up last night on my 9-10pm slot. I stood with the front door open  waiting from 8.55-10.30pm. I call Tesco  lovely man advises me that driver couldn t find the house and couldn t get through via telephone (did 1471 on house phone  was a call days ago but nothing today at all- mobile  no missed calls at all) but that the driver will redeliver tomorrow AM with a few extra goodies thrown in as compensation  and be rest assured there are NO substitutions. (I asked to be called prior to delivery if there were to be). Fast forward to this morning - my order arrives AFTER the agreed revised time slot with numerous substitutions namely most of my family sized desserts for New Years Day family gathering....instead I m sent 20 (yes 20!!!!) INDIVIDUAL cream cakes!!!?? in replacement for large family sized desserts. To add insult to the injury there was nothing extra thrown into the order as promised.  My driver this morning was lovely  said would refund for all food substitutes and that I could keep the cakes üò≥.... I ve just called customer services and been offered a ¬£10 voucher for the inconvenience?! I ve now got to take all my children food shopping to find desserts- ¬£10 won t even cover the fuel I ll use  let alone compensate for miserable children and the stress!! I ve had Tesco home delivery for years but maybe time to try a different company üò°üò°üò°üò°üò°

Hello      I was shopping in your Tesco Silverburn store on Monday 18th December when after being in for around 20 minutes; I noticed my Next shopping bag wasn‚Äôt on my person anymore. I dropped my basket and ran around the aisles I‚Äôd been to see if I had mislaid it etc. It wasn‚Äôt there. I started to really panic and get quite upset as the next bag had ¬£70 worth of baby outfits inside. I‚Äôd only bought them 20 minutes previous. I ran to the customer services desk  where they told me no (and without any obvious empathy either) I asked the security men who were standing by the door  at the CCTV cameras  if anyone had handed to them. They said no. I said would there be any way they could quickly check past 5 minutes of cctv incase the bag and potential thief were still in the store. They told me no and that I would have to come back tomorrow?! (Helpful). I  again  ran around all the aisles. At this point  I was actually crying with panic because I knew I wouldn‚Äôt be able to afford to buy these presents again. I asked a few employees again if anything had been handed in. They all said no... One actually said ‚Äònaw hen  it‚Äôs probably been lifted!‚Äô‚Ä¶ Not very helpful and frankly quite upsetting.      I stood at the door. Revisited the customer service desk and the various other desks (opticians etc.) a couple more times before I eventually gave up and left to go home. On the way home  I remembered an area I hadn‚Äôt revisited. I tried calling customer services to see if there would be any way they could check the specific area for me  as I don‚Äôt live near this particular Tesco. I got through to a call centre. They told me to drive back if I wanted to check it. (Wish I‚Äôd have thought of that myself Mrs Brains!?!)  From that point on  I got the local customer services number and proceeded to call the desk 13 times in total over a 6 hour period. They either never answered or hung up when they heard my voice. I spoke to one lady from these 13 attempts who seemed to be the only helpful employee in the whole store. She did check the area for me- unfortunately the bag wasn‚Äôt there either.     I returned to the store the following day to query the CCTV. The gentleman phoned his colleague to come down to the main entrance where my partner & I were waiting. I told him the exact time I entered the store  what I was wearing  what bags I was holding and told him the first place I headed for. He left and told me to come back in 15 minutes once he‚Äôd looked at the playback. When he returned  the gentleman said these exact words ‚ÄòYes I can see you on the camera. You came in with the bag and left without it‚Äô‚Ä¶..    He‚Äôd spent 15/20 apparently looking at CCTV... to tell me that? Useless information that I quite obviously KNEW. He then proceeded to lie to me... ‚ÄòWhen you came in  you veered over to the right and I didn‚Äôt catch where you went after that‚Äô... I replied ‚ÄòNo  I didn‚Äôt go over to the right at all? I went straight ahead. I went straight for the wrapping paper?‚Äô He replied ‚ÄòNo cos I seen you and your boyfriend go that way?‚Äô‚Ä¶    My boyfriend hadn‚Äôt been with me.       I am a retail manager. I regularly watch CCTV. I asked him had he not followed my route? Had it been the other way around... I would have followed a customer in segments to see at what point the bag wasn‚Äôt on their person anymore... Not only could I narrow it down and save myself time... but I also then be able to inform the customer of where & when exactly the bag was taken. I told him this. I wrote down my full route of the store and asked him to look at it for me. He said it would take him couple of hours... I reluctantly agreed that he could just call me instead. He said he‚Äôd phone me that night once he could confirm what the fate of the bag was. After this  I began to wonder how he‚Äôd seen me leave without my shopping bag if he hadn‚Äôt followed my route? Probably another lie...     That was the 19th December. It‚Äôs now the 31st. I‚Äôve never received that call back.   As a retail manager  I am genuinely appalled at this level of customer service. To show no empathy to a young girl who is visibly upset is bad enough. To ignore calls  hang up on customers  lie to their face and never give them the call back promised to them is horrific.   To make matters worse  I‚Äôve since been informed by an employee of the next store that I also revisited  that Tesco Silverburn are hopeless at helping people in circumstances like this. That is awful. I will never step foot in your store again. I know Tesco won‚Äôt care that 1 person  a number like me won‚Äôt shop there again... but hopefully people reading this never have to rely on the staff of the Tesco Silverburn store ever again. They are useless and quite clearly have no regard for their customers and their customers‚Äô possessions.

Dear tescos..... Today I visited your superstore in Kidderminster all I wanted was 150 bread rolls....not a lot really but as I was happily filling my trolley up with your bread rolls I was approached by a store worker who had a very disgusted look on his face at me and then he started talking....in the most disrespectful manner possible telling me that I should have ordered the rolls (yes maybe I should have if I could get thro to somebody) and that he is now going to have to deal with angry people because I took all the bread rolls!!even tho there s a bakery inside this tescos!surely if I want to go into a Tesco superstore and buy 150 rolls off the shelf I should be aloud to with out being made to feel like I ve done the worst thing in the world by someone who has the mannerisms of an angry goat!

Just wanted to say a huge thank you to tesco for adding milk to a product my little boy has been having for years  with no warning. He has a severe allergy to milk and I now have a very poorly 6 year old and lost a day s pay! Happy new year tesco!

Well I LOVED all the glitter from the reindeer paper bring everywhere in my house. In fact I m still finding it my downstairs loo floor and shall be leaving it there for my NYE celebrations tonight üëçüèªüéâüéä

Having literally just visited you re high wycombe town centre (Eden) store. I m really disgusted at your attempt to mill me and my children. Whilst travelling on your travellator from the top floor back to the first floor  I received a mains electrical shock to my left ring finger. The shock was large enough to cause my forearm muscles to contract. I am an electronics engineer and I am well aware of the difference between static discharge and a mains electrical discharge. I immediately held my children away from the sides. And contacted a member of staff to ensure they shut off the power supply immediately. This didnt happen. They tried to fob me off with a static story until eventually I insisted the store manager attend. When she did I told her in the interest of public safety it needed to be turned off until an electrical safety check could be carried out. Unbelievably she said she would need to check with the area manager!!!!!!!   What if this had been a child? What if the next time it stops someone s heart? This is an  appalling health and safety attitude!!!!!  Please please get the travellator shut off and get it checked!!!!!!

Bought your mulled scented washing up liquid this year and it s splashed up my jumper and stained it! Even though I rinsed it straight away  so have a red stain right in the middle. What is in the soap and any ideas to get it out my newish jumper?

Just watched someone cough and splutter all over the fresh produce in Maryhill Tesco Extra. Having just recovered from a bad chest infection  this has now galvanised me to find another place to do my shopping. I spend thousands per year at your store as well! No more!
Yeah i was coming out today with them my husband bought 2 packets and he had 2 now he is away to his work sick so i don t know what has happened but i don t just want refund.

I LOVED ur reindeer wrapping paper! I wrapped my gifts on our bed which resulted sparkly hubby only for me üòçüôà win win! Best pressie ever üòú and sellotape stick to it - just don t stick it to the glitter part - simples!

I can t believe you paid someone for whinging about the Reindeer paper glitter! who spends ¬£30 on wrapping paper when its only ¬£2 a roll?! most people like myself loved it and it hoovered up ok and proper sellotape stuck to it ok... i did however buy some of your lovely sausage rolls and now i have pastry crumbs on my carpet!! hahahahaha :D :D ;)
For anyone who buys the meal for 1 microwave curry meal make sure you check dates and everything before you end up with the state I m in.
Wait let me give this a try üò°üò°üò°(angry face emoji) Glitter... give me free stuff (Did it work?)
Who s putting Pork on the halal meat in Tesco?

Just won t to say we love the glitter paper in our house and I m sure there are loads of other people that did aswell... thank you üëçüèº
I think your Reindeer paper was wonderful and my sellotape worked wonderfully on it. !
My husband brought cheese rolls for my daughter and she was getting 1 and to fine a fly in it ragingüò°üò°üò°

What is the world coming too when glitter wrapping paper is more important than a changing place?  Tesco when will you be putting changing places into your stores?  Currently we are having to lie our children on a dirty toilet floor with no space  this is degrading and inhumane  Have any of you ever been in your disabled or regular toilets? Now imagine having to lie your child on the floor and kneeling down yourself on the floor   We need changing places in every store for your customers.
Last time I buy a ¬£80 Hoover from @Tesco note to all don t buy one from them if u want it to last more than a year üò°üò°

Dear Tesco. We have just bought your  Finest  Sticky toffee pudding  as a treat  because we are ill  and going to miss out on a lovely new years celebration with friends... I am a fairly new delivery customer  about 5 deliveries in total. My first delivery had the following missing item...shower gel! I have said that I will take substitutes but it said no substitute available!!! Am I dealing with a corner shop here? I really can t imagine no shower gel on your shelves. I didn t bother to complain at the time just thought a minor fault. Let s go on to the second delivery  on taking out the fridge bag I could see it wasn t mine! The young deli very man went to phone his team leader  returning to me he said I had two options  either money credited or goods redelivered the next day  which I think was the Saturday. This was the option I chose  he was unable to give me a time slot  but after staying in all day there was no delivery. I then phoned the customer service in Wales  they tried to get in touch with my Southampton but for whatever reason were unable to have a conversation with them. At this stage I elected to take a refund for the goods. Later in the week I did receive a telephone call from yourselves apologising and offering me a ¬£10 voucher off me next delivery  which I accepted. She did say that after asking team leaders they said that they had not had a call from the delivery man!  My next couple of deliveries were okay.....now we come to my delivery of yesterday. I was away for Christmas so this order was covering a meal for company yesterday but what should be missing...my pork leg joint!!!! and a picking fault  the security tag on a bottle of whisky. After about 5 minutes of trying to remove tag by the delivery man we had to admit defeat  he did say I could send it back but seeing how I needed it for my guest that was not an option. I phoned customer service again who contacted Southampton who duly phoned me. This phone call was not helpful and I was given the option to go into store and pick a joint  of which on consulting your sight were plentiful! including the one that I had chosen.  To make things worse I have prepaid for 12 months delivery because as you can imagine I am not very happy with your deliveries . My customer number is 105306237

Absolutely disgusted with the attitude of your call centre staff! Having ordered a wooden kitchen for our niece for Christmas  it arrived in good time and was set aside for the big day. Upon opening the gift  it was found that one of the plastic panels had a severe crack in it  rendering the item dangerous and unusable. Having travelled over 2hrs to drop the gift off in the first place  we explained to your call centre staff member that we were unable to exchange the item in store and that they were welcome to collect. Having agreed to send a replacement out to our local store  we asked if there was anything else that could be done  as in addition to having a very upset little girl on Christmas morning  who had waited months for her desired present  we would now have to take another trip  over 2hrs in order to deliver it to her and the magic of the present being from Santa had been lost. This has not only inconvenience us  in that we both work full time and the delivery of this gift to our niece would now be very much delayed  but it is also  obviously  very difficult to explain to a very young child that her gift will not be with her for another lengthy period. Having explained this to your staff member  he merely laughed at my partner over the phone  which is not only poor customer service  but extremely rude behaviour and as a result we will definitely be thinking long and hard before we shop with you again. Having worked for you ourselves  in management positions previous to our current employment  we were unaware that your customer service training had altered so greatly  or been omitted altogether!

Absolutely disgusted at a member of your judgemental staff tonight! Dear Tesco why do you teach your staff poppycock. Today I visited my local branch  Swan Centre) and used scan and shop. Myself and my 3 year old enjoy doing this  and she had a very special treat she was allowed to buy ¬£15 of toys. A massive treat!  So we found a LOVELY Pink cat with sparkly eyes  it didn t scan  and said that it was not on the stock file and see the staff at the till. My daughter  needless to say  was EXTREMELY excited  a pink cat that even had glittery eyes  what more could a 3 year old want?  We got to the till  scanned and it asked if something wouldn t scan  so hit yes. The slightly helpful man  sauntered over  took the teddy that my daughter was excited about  couple of minutes later  sorry madam you can t buy this  it s not on file  it s a Health and Safety issue .... Sorry what? A health and safety issue  are you taking the mick??? A pink cat teddy  what s it gonna do? Throat slam me as I put it in the car? So I calmly ask  sooooo  the toys faulty  and on your shelves? ‚Äú his baffled response   no its just a health and safety issue .  My now upset 3 year old  had to watch the pink cat  be taken  and put in the basket of no return. So now I have a distraught child  no flipping pink cat with glittery eyes  and tears as she sat in the car with nothing to hug.  Please don t stock your shelves with toys that can not be sold  and definitely don t teach your staff that just because something isn t on stock file  that they should tell customers it s a Health and safety issue. My daughter  crying in the back of the car however is a health and safety issue.  Thanks Tesco for spoiling our special treat.

On Christmas morning my 8yr old daughter was over the moon Santa had given her the gift she asked for  an ipod touch. Unfortunately when she opened it it would not turn on  we then charged it for 2hrs and still nothing appeared on the screen to say it was charging or even to just turn on. The whole of Christmas day was ruined for her as she didnt get much else to play with and she was very upset thinking how  Santa  would be able to fix it and he might not be able to do anything. I reassured her I would go and buy her a new ipod and she even offered to give me her ¬£35 she recieved from others for Christmas to help with the cost.   I sent an email to the CEO straight away but still havent got a reply!   Now I decide to take it back to Tesco Peterborough and ask for an exchange as it was faulty  but the lady who served me (Jane) asked for my card  I found that strange as it was just an exchange and as I went to put my card in the machine I said to her I wanted an exchange but she just said  the money will go back onto your account within 3-5working days  I then said that I never wanted a refund and I asked for an exchange  she got funny with me and said I never said that. I was more cross that I only had ¬£250 in my account and that was going on bills and that I promised my daughter I would get a new ipod and now because of this womans mistake I would either have to wait a few days to recieve the money back to purchase a new 1 and let my daughter down once again  or buy her a new 1 and me struggle for a few days.   This is probably going to be my daughters last year of believing in Santa and her day was ruined because of the faulty product I purchased from Tesco.   All they could offer me was ¬£20 fuel costs for the inconvenience! In my opinion it was not good enough for the mistake a collegue had made and also had an attitude who offered no help and also still having no reply from the CEO regarding my email of complaint!   I will be emailing the CEO again.  Elisa Conte

Can some one please advise me as to who exactly I contact with regards to a Hatchimal which i purchased from your Watford store in November. The Hatchimal has now become a thorn in my side. After searching for one for my great granddaughter  who is 8 years old  for a surprise christmas present I thought all my troubles were over when I was visiting my stepdaughter in Watford and we shopped in your Extra store there. Eureka !! Ifound a pink Hatchimal sitting there   I bought it   thought problems solved. Christmas day arrives and my great granddaughter arrives at my home with Mum and Dad for dinner. She opens all her gifts first and then i gave her the Hatchimal which she didn t know she might be getting. The excitement on her face  she couldn t believe that she had one. She does have problems in getting over excited so she was getting frustrated getting it out of the packaging so I took it out and she proceeded to follow the instructions as she saw them to get this thing to Hatch. after twenty minutes of her getting more and more frustrated and no sign of anything happening with this Hatchimal   I started to investigate it . i followed the instructions to the letter and it did absolutely nothing ?? There was no obvious signs of how to check batteries or even where they fitted in etc. During the initial handling the shell did start to feel soft and pliable in parts and pieces of the shell came off for us to discover this tiny little wide eyed creature sitting inside doing absolutely nothing ??? Now for  cutting the long story short  what has made it worse was that one of her cousins also received one and we have since seen what they are supposed to do so we are now certain that we have a DUD. I went on line to a website they said to check in the instructions and then found a free phone number to ring to troubleshoot. This kept me on the line with a recorded voice asking me to wait and some one would attend to me . Needless to say after patiently waiting for two hours( good job it was free) I got tired and hung up. I then went on line to tesco site   which i now realise is the Tesco Direct  and found the number to contact some one with regards to this. i have spoken them today and after going through all the ritual of name number etc. and asking me to hold  a very polite young man then informs me that they have no record of my order on my account ?? I again explained that i bought it in the store and he then said oh Im sorry we can t help you   this is Tesco Direct so we have no record of your buying this item. he said i would have to return it to the store. As I bought it in Watford and I live a couple of hundred miles away I don t think this was very helpful. I would like some one to come back to me to advise what to do now with a totally defunct Hatchimal   a lot of money out of pocket and most important of all a most upset  disappointed great granddaughter  and no type of recompense can help sort this out. She is just so upset. I look forward to hearing from some one by return to try and resolve this for her. Thank you

Just wanted to say how appalled I am with the customer service I received at the customer services desk at Tesco Western Avenue 27/12/16. I was told to take a non electrical toy to the electrical desk  when asked why as it s not electrical the staff member said she would serve me. I was told yes (in reply to my question about the paper and it came up on the till) Brilliant I thought  managed to pay the difference for my good in between her chatting to her mates and hardly looking at us let alone speak to us. She was so engrossed in her conversation  she didn t ask if I had a Clubcard. So after serving me I asked her to add the point to which she huffed. I left the store biting my tongue. Got home and checked my receipt and the wrapping paper didn t come up as 3 for 2. Im more annoyed with the fact that she had no time for us as customers and was more interested in talking to her colleague mates and was dismissive of us more than the fact she blatantly had no idea i had asked about the paper and just smiled at me.

The XXL turkey we bought from Tesco appears to have had an eating disorder as when I came to carve it I found I couldn t. After peeling off the skin  in a manner akin to finding the end of the sellotape  I could see the reason I couldn t carve it was because it was all bone. I barely managed to offer a family of 6 a tablespoon sized portion of turkey each which I d managed to peel from the legs and wings. I m not going to claim it ruined Christmas because  frankly  Christmas consists of more than a few slices of warmed up bird corpse but I can t say I m happy having paid ¬£25 for food items expected to provide for a few meals only to find it couldn t effectively cover a single family Christmas dinner.

Tesco maybe you could donate some from your local store! :) Staff at the RSPCA s East Winch Wildlife Centre near King s Lynn are appealing for people to donate washing up liquid.  The centre uses Fairy liquid and similar to clean the animal accommodation and its also handy for cleaning oiled birds.  Staff and volunteers are currently caring for 172 hedgehogs  40 seal pups  29 swans and other wildlife casualties.  This year  the centre has cared for more than 4 000 patients. Anyone who would like to help to keep the animals clean with donations of washing-up liquid can be sent to the Centre or left in the yellow bins at the front of the RSPCA East Winch Wildlife Centre building.

Hello Tesco. I am writing to seek some information on your Brussel sprouts. We are now two hours post Xmas dinner but the wind hasn t arrived. This has led to the cancellation of the twelfth annual Stokes family farting competition.   We have our suspicions that these sprouts have been genetically modified to reduce the output of the happy gasses that normally abound post dinner and support the competition.   As the defending champion  My 86 year old gran  is inconsolable that she hasn t had the opportunity to defend her crown. She had promised wind to match that of storm Barbara  We feel that you should‚Äã mark the packaging with estimated happy gas output so as to allow customers to make better choices.  I m not saying you have ruined our Christmas festivities but it has put a huge dent in family morale. The turkey crown and pigs in blankets were most excellent so we congratulate you on this aspect of the meal.   It could be there is a delay in the action of the sprouts and I will feed back if this is the case but we are normally well underway by now.  I would be grateful if you could confirm if anything has changed with the genetic make up of this usually wonderful vegetable.  Lastly we would like to thank all the wonderful staff at your Hunstanton store who bent over backwards to be so friendly and helpful with our Christmas shop. We wouldn t want there good name sullied by the failure of the sprouts.  Best wishes  The Stokes

Hi!  I visited Tesco new ollerton store today with my disabled mother. As I could imagine we was greeted by a very busy store!  My mum uses the wheel chairs that Tesco have  but today both were in use. Whilst hovering around in hope of locating one I was greeted by a lovely Gentleman called Douglas who was giving out free magic reindeer food to the passing children and to which he handed me some too for my children who were patiently waiting at home which I thanked him for. He then went out of his way to help locate a chair for my mother whilst we waited in the cafe with a cuppa and when he located one he came straight to us. We then went in to do our shopping two trolleys became a handful! So at the checkout who appears? Douglas!! What a little Gem he helped to bag up our shopping in a bigger trolley and then took it to our car where he then packed it In Our boot! He then went onto offer to return the wheel chair and trolley too but not before wishing us a wonderful Christmas!  Douglas you re a credit to Tesco! One of the nicest staff I ve ever met and I mean that!  I m sorry I didn t get your surname but I recall you telling me all about you being semi retired.  Tesco this guy deserves a well deserved pat on the back!  Merry Christmas to you all xx

First of all I want to say how disappointed I was with your veg pricing this Christmas. My other two local supermarkets (Asda Aldi) was offering the essentials for 19p each...carrots  parsnips  potatoes  broccoli and sewed. Tesco was twice the price and more with the swede at ¬£1 and potatoes even higher. When I mentioned this to your staff at the octocal way store swindon the reply was .... there is a Aldi 2mins away so go there !  With this reply I emptied my full basket of veg rite there on the bananas n replied back ok I will... please it these back for me.  Also I had purchased 2 bath tin sets ( that s so Betty ) on sale of a caged table in middle of the store  these were marked up on yellow A4 price card reduced to ¬£3.50. On checkout I was charged ¬£7.50 and reported the charge to your customer service desk who said the price is correct without even looking and offered me a full refund  I said I want the items but the ticket showed ¬£3.50 and want it looked at.  The ladie went off to look and said it was the wrong ticket and had taken it off the stand. She then offered to refund me the over charge amount but when I said about the double the difference policy she said no as doing it as a good will gesture ..... I asked again about the policy and told the question is getting big n she was alone . My option is refund the over payment or full refund pick one. Well I took the part refund obviously but if you have these policy s then the staff should honour  them .  That s my rant over. Enjoy your Christmas üéÑ

Tesco stores don t care for the elderly  they have stopped a bus service picking up seniors and dropping them off at the store at Bidston Moss in the Wirral. She uses a tri wheeler and find the distance to the bus stop and train station exhausting  if not impossible. SHAME ON YOU TESCO. I have voiced my opinion before and e-mailed you  but no reply. SHAME ON YOU AGAIN!!!! I won t be shopping there anymore and I shall tell colleagues  friends and I shall keep posting on Face Book until you decided to do something positive.

A couple of weeks ago I did my weekly shop at Tesco Leytonstone with my son who is 7. He likes to ride his scooter to Tesco as we live locally. He always leaves his scooter in the correct place at the front with all the other scooters and buggies. After we finished our shop we were leaving when we realised we had forgotten my sons scooter so he ran back inside to get it. My son came back out in tears. He told me your security guard had called him a  stupid boy  because he had knocked someone elses scooter over. I went back inside to ask the security guard what had happened but immediately he was very aggressive verbally and started shouting at me. I asked for his name but he declined to give it to me so I took a picture of him that I can show you privately to identify. I then went to customer services and asked to speak with a manager. I told your manager what had happened and it really was evident my son was telling the truth because as I was telling the manager the security guard was telling other people about it and pointing at us. Your manager apologised to me and my son and let him chose out a box of chocolates as an apology which was very kind of you. Another of your workers at customer services told me that this was not the first time there had been problems with security guards but that there was little to be done because they are employed by a different company and not Tesco. As we were leaving the security guard was shouting at the manager who was trying to deal with the situation. I found this appalling but felt it better to leave it at that.  However I have now felt compelled to write a complaint on here because the security guard has since appear intimidating to us when we have gone back to Tesco Leytonstone on different occasion to do our weekly shop. Last week as myself and my son were walking into Tesco to do our weekly shop he pointed at us out to another security guard and was I assume telling his colleague god knows what about us. I ignored this. However today I popped in to Tesco Leytonstone with my son to pick up some last minute items. As we were walking down one of the isles the security guard walked up to us  stopped and starred at my son up and down. Again I ignored this and just pulled my son along by the hand.   This is not acceptable behaviour. I should be able to do my shopping in Tesco without feeling intimidated or worried. I live local and have shopped at Tesco Leytonstone since it opened. In fact I was present at Tesco Leytonstone when Dirty Den from Eastenders came to cut the ribbon to officially open the store! I spend a lot of money at Tesco Leytonstone as we dont have much of a high street and its literally around the corner from me but I will be forced to shop elsewhere should this sort of intimidation and unprofessional behaviour continue. I am being treated like what feels a potential thief and who knows what he has told other staff about me/us? Hi I just wanted to say how utterly disappointed I am   I ordered my son an plum 8ft trampoline with enclosure from Tesco direct which I picked up from new ollerton branch and put straight away when I got home as it was my sons Christmas present this was on the 3rd of December  today being Christmas Eve we have got it out to build ready for the morning and we find 2 of the same boxes  I went straight up to to Tesco ollerton branch spoke to a lovely lady called Stephanie (who couldn t have been more helpful) she tried to locate another trampoline in other stores without any success she also rang Tesco direct and the lady she spoke to told her it s my fault for not checking and when Stephanie asked if there was anything they can do as a good gesture she was told no again as it s my fault they can only give me a refund so thank you Tesco direct you have completely ruined my sons Christmas I will not order another item from you again I am now frantically driving and ringing around other shops to find my son a trampoline all are a lot more expensive and hassle I don t need on a day when I should be with my children enjoying Christmas Eve festivities! Absolutely wrong how I ve been dealt with over the phone!

Absolutely furious!!  shopped in the llansamlet branch on the 22nd December.  I m currently 5 1/2 months pregnant and after trying to be careful of what I eat and being mindful of what I can t   I decided to endulge for Xmas and bought a father Xmas cheesecake for ¬£4 to be used this lastnight.  After our meal last night my partner took the cheesecake out of the fridge and portioned it up for us both. Just as I went to take my first bite  he came rushing in and told me to stop. Turns out the cheesecake was infact out of date. Although sold to us on the 22nd the use by date on the packaging was the 19th!!  it was 3 days passed it s sell by before it had even left the shop. I m absolutely disgusted.  had I had eaten this cheesecake being a fresh dairy product both myself and my partner could of been seriously ill over Xmas.  Without even mentioning the impact this would of had on my unborn child. I understand it s a busy time of year.  But for this item to of been left unnoticed for 3 days on the shelf is terrible!!!

Just wanted to say how disappointed i was with tesco customer service today.  My mum sent my family and i a ¬£100 tesco voucher to spend on extra christmas treats but sadly when our post arrived this morning it had been removed from the envelope.  Royal mail refused to even search the postmans bag and so we turned to tesco for some help. After trawling every shopping bag in the house my very upset mum managed to find a receipt that had the whole gift card number on it. Several calls to tesco later and they agreed to block the card from being used and even offered ¬£50 (sent to us via royal mail - no thanks!!) As a goodwill gesture instead of the ¬£100 voucher that had already been purchased. We requested a number of times that the full balance be transfered to a new card or even an online evoucher as we use tesco online weekly to do our ¬£200 food shop. This was absolutely  point blank refused. Why? We can prove the card was purchased  have receipts and credit card statements to back this up yet tesco  2 days before christmas wouldnt allow us the gift that had already been paid for for us.   We now have to rely on a post office claim form to POSSIBLY come up trumps and find our missing voucher but have been told it could take up to 12 weeks just to be processed. Assuming it hasnt already been pocketed by someone - likely!  #tesco  i am incredibly disappointed in your lack of cooperation today. The gift card was lost  we didnt want a refund  just the funds transfered so they could be spent in your store!  Bah humbug!

Just visited the store in Bathgate with my daughter aged 5. While going up and down the isles I came across 2 members of staff having a full in ear shot discusion and slagging match about customers. They were making comments about how many customers were at the store and how busy it was then to my disgust the comment came about how  metal  and  off our heads  we were for being there at this time of night!!!!   I feel now I need to explain WHY we were there at 10:30p.m with a 5 year. My daughter has a condition called hyperacousis.....Google it. It is where she has over sensitive hearing and being in a busy place  music and loads of people talking is scary  loud and over bearing. It is a documented disability and to have members of YOUR staff slagging YOUR customers off makes me sick. Totally disgusted at this and feel comments like that are what makes me scared people judge my daughter. I will not be back and am ashamed of the members of staff who made these comments. Maybe they should live one day in my daughters shoes and also be educated on hyperacousis and the affects these nasty comments have on my daughter  myself and customers. üò≤üò≤üò≤üò≤üò≤üò≤

Well Tesco  you failed to deliver the one item my daughter asked for Christmas. Most people would assume it was a highly sought after item  or a very expensive item. I feel we have been sent on a wild goose chase  been made promises that haven t been kept and been lied to. psst... TESCO...  When you mark up Ben and Jerry s ice cream in your stores as being on offer:  Any 2 for ¬£6 400-500ml ... Tesco  you have truly gone mad! I shopped in the Nailsea branch this evening  as I have ever since it opened. To do my Xmas shop I took my 17 year old son as I required two trollies. Having already put  boxes of beer  cider and wine in my trolley myself I asked my son to get three individual bottles of cider. My son was approached in the soft drink isle later on and told that he would not be able to buy the alcohol unless he had identification. My son stated that he was with me and that he wasn t buying the alcohol. My son fetched me and I explained the situation. Astoundingly  I was informed that because he put the alcohol in the trolley it was considered by Tesco s that I was purchasing it on his behalf. Consequently   I was refused sale of the alcohol and it was taken from me. I was then informed I could not come in to the store and purchase alcohol for another 24 hours. I fully understand why Tesco s and other supermarkets have measures to prevent alcohol bring purchased on behalf of minors however this was an utterly ridiculous over reaction with a spectacular failure to apply any common sense. TESCO S GET A GRIP  YOU DO NOT DESERVE MY LOYAL CUSTOM. STAFF TRAINING AND ADVICE URGENTLY NEEDED.

I am absolutely appalled with Tesco Grocery today. My groceries were delivered on time  but with several Christmas dinner items missing. I immediately called customer services who contacted the driver to arrange re-delivery. The driver returned and stated that he had delivered my items to another customer and although he had been back there  he didn‚Äôt have my missing items. He offered me a crate of items to look through for my items ‚Äòor something similar‚Äô  there weren‚Äôt any. He advised he would contact the warehouse with a list of my missing items and have them sent out to me today. I contacted Customer services again (10am) to ensure that this had happened - it had not.   Customer services contacted the store and called me back stating the items would be redelivered today and that the store would call me with a time slot.  At 1:30pm I had not heard from the store so  again  contacted customer services to enquire about my missing groceries. I was put on hold while the store was contacted only to be told that the store ‚Äòdidn‚Äôt have the man power to redelivery my groceries today as they already had 120 redeliveries from yesterday‚Äô. The customer services manager advised that my items would then be refunded.  I asked to be transferred to a team leader who advised he would again contact the store or try to have the items put aside in a local express store. On calling back  he  again  said the store would not redeliver due to a lack of ‚Äòman power‚Äô and that no local store had all of the items that were missing - what a surprise two days before Christmas!   Clearly  Tesco  you have overstretched yourselves and are unable to fulfil the orders that you have taken. Online grocery shopping is supposed to be convenient and stress free - it has been neither today. After one redelivery  4 phone calls and 6 hours of waiting  I now have to shop for my missing goods.  Absolutely unacceptable.

My son was in your Lockerbie store the other day and went to buy a bottle of gin. He was asked for id and being over the legal age to buy alcohol  he did have id. He was with his 14year old sister  who was then also asked for id. As she isn t over 18  she has no id. So the sale was refused.  He explained that he knows the think 25 policy and as his sister didn t touch the alcohol or even ask about it  there was no proof it was a proxy sale  so there was no need to refuse it (this statement is in fact correct  I have done my think 25 Tesco policy training!)  Team support was called and also agreed that he was correct but she was refusing the sale! He said that he would just come back once he had dropped his sister off. He was then told that any future sales would also be refused! Well tesco ely that was a totally shambolic attempt at getting my xmas shopping experience right! Never experienced any supermarket shop like it. After using aldi for the main shop i visitted at approx 9:30 tonight for my top end goods. Almost every aisle had new stock littered on both sides making it hazardous and very difficult to pass another trolley. Key lines like bread sauce and cranberry were either empty with replen stock on the floor or top shelf. I chose to unpack my own to glares from a colleague! Most of the staff were discussing how bad it was to work there and i heard one person so it will imrove in the new year. When arriving at the 2 open till points  there were huge queues. After 10 mins one more till opened and poor chanel had no keys. Apologising and hoping i would pay by card as she couldnt take cash. She was very pleasant but by the time i finished at the checkout the queues were down the aisles. A clearly more experiences colleague tried to get more tills open but said sorry hardly anyones trained and we have no where near enough people employed for xmas. Visible leadership. Nope none! Really really disapointed.
Is hereford tesco  not doing delivery service ? Just tried to book a slot for tomorrow Friday the 23rd and says it s unavailable.

Immensely disappointed Tesco with  the  Christmas online order several substitutions; two of which means I have to go out to Asda tomorrow totally defeating the object!!!   Please correct me if i am wrong  but having put my order in on the 26 November; I was not expecting any substitutions as this is ample time to order everything the customer has requested but obviously not.   I mean who actually wants shallots gravy well not me!!   So thankyou Tesco  I now have to fit in another shop to get the things you failed to provide. What adds insult to injury  is that due to the christmas period  I was told my refund will be delayed the absolute audacity!  I feel the whole charade has been a waste of my precious time. You may want to revise your slogan as this day in age every little does not help  and does not cut the mustard. when it comes to online shopping we want everything we have ordered not just a little of it otherwise we would not have ordered it in the first place! Note to self  lesson well and truly learnt.

I d like to take the time to inform you of today s happenings. I ordered a grocery delivery from click and collect at your Batley store for 4-6pm. I arrived at 4.45pm with my 6 year old to collect my goods to be told I would have no paperwork for at least half an hour (so no idea of substitutions). I accepted this and started loading my shopping. I asked the member of staff where the rest of it was  as it looked sparse and i could identify a few missing items from memory. He rang to enquire  said it would be 10 minutes. I parked up and took my diabetic son for a drink and snack as he was feeling hypo. We returned at 5.45pm to collect the remainder of my shopping  paperwork now available - I discovered a good number of items still missing! The member of staff got the manager on the phone for me who  after listening to my disappointment  noted the missing items and promised them delivering out to me later this evening. Tesco ensured the items arrived 2 hours later  along with a sorry card  box of chocolates and small toy for my son - fantastic gestures! Could you please ensure the female manager in question receives a thank you from me and my family. I understand there had been a major issue with computers and orders being lost/wrong (and a fire alarm) but a desirable conclusion was obtained through going the extra mile. Many thanks.
Thank you very much for ruining my sons Christmas and for your call centres lack of empathy! Really means a lot!!!

A courtesy call from him to tell me he d be 10 minutes late & delivered with a smile...Thank you Jon & Merry Christmas. Tesco.... can we please have more drivers like Jon at the Erith depot.

Come 940.still no groceries and I m dying to go to bed its been a long few days with a sick baby  I called them to be on hold for 20 mins . Nice one Tesco s .. way to ruin my nicely planned Christmas

Went to your Aberystwyth store today and my 3 year old obviously woke up on the wrong side of the bed...in hindsight the strop he threw before I d even left should of given me enough warning to just stay at home. But no  I wanted to go  I was feeling brave enough to risk another meltdown by said 3 year old...in public.  The meltdown happened as we were leaving your store because we took the lift instead of the escalator  (seriously) ...my son then ran in front of me to run to our car  crying and angry at the world he nearly ran into the road  I shouted... 2 security guards were standing in the car park and one security man called Richy grabbed my son to stop him running over the zebra crossing as a car was coming. His reaction was so quick and I was already so grateful...not only that they (I m sorry I don t know the other ones name) then helped me to load the car  talked to me to calm me down and we re so friendly and lovely and really deserve some recognition. üëèüëèüëè Thankyou Richy and other security guard for your kindness today. Ordered my Christmas food delivery shop to be delivered between 5pm-7pm tonight..at 7:15pm was thinking to myself  where the hell is our delivery? They re never late ....well stupid me selected click and collect (no idea why I did this! I never do!) So I frantically made my way to your Tesco Extra Excelsior Est branch  Cardiff.  Got there by 7:30..Click and Collect were closed. Ran to the customer service desk where I explained how much of an idiot I was to a very lovely lady. I then get a call from the Tesco lads who kindly said they d bring my food shop down to the service desk. When they arrived (after apologising and thanking them numerous times) I said I was going to get a trolley to put it in. They told me not to worry and they d bring it to my car. I was fully prepared for you to give me a refund  send me on my way and I d be desperately rushing around to get the Christmas food shop in time! Hi Tesco  I have delivery saver and have two deliveries a week. Normally I m very happy and accept any substitutions. My delivery arrived yesterday whilst I was at work and my husband accepted it. I know this maybe the correct policy  but the whole point of delivery is not to go in store especially at the busiest time of year. I am happy to store the goods until my next home delivery and return them to the driver then. I am disappointed in customer service response to offer no solution other than go into store. Thank you

Hello  As I have asked many times before...  I have just been in your Winchester Avenue  Exeter store to do some shopping with the intention of putting items in the food bank and once again there is no presence of the food bank collection box/point.  Please can you clarify this is a logistic decision by the charity involved and not one by yourself.  I will be contacting my local food banks and attempt to clarify the situation.  Please can you just check if there is a food bank point permanently. Did I just visit on a day when it had been temporarily removed. Is it a choice by the foodbank charity to manage/withdraw it.  There is ample room in that store to permanently place one regardless of how much is deposited in it and there are many of us in the community who want to support it if it is present  especially this time of year under the current economic climate.  I simply wish to be reliably able to deposit items when I shop  I don t want to either know or get drawn into ins and outs or internal politics of the matter.   Thanks.  Joe C.

A very BIG thank you to TESCO Cliftonville for giving me all the ingredients to cook for 26 people at St Pauls Church as part of the Thanet Shelter Programme run by the Salvation Army. We visited Tesco Brockworth earlier this week and were greeted by a lady who invited us to take some nibbles from a snack table. The children enjoyed the cheese on sticks. We were told that there was a grotto to visit so after we did our shop  we visited. After queuing for 20 mins or so the children were shy of seeing Santa  but the Elves and Santa could not have been more helpful. They took the time for us to have a photo  the elf sat with the children in the sleigh and Santa stood behind. They really couldn t have been more helpful  caring and professional. There was a craft table too and we took home some fab decorations. In the run up to Christmas this was such a thoughtful and welcome experience. I just wanted to say a huge  well done  and  thank you  to the wonderful people at Tesco Brockworth in Gloucester  I hope that this message makes it s way to those involved by way of appreciation. I will definitely be shopping here again!  No response needed.

I ve been mailing tesco customer service for about two weeks now about and it is becoming increasing obvious that the customer service people do not read English!! Please can you sort out my issue. My email address is deirdremarie.osullivan@hotmail.com please read the emails and tell me your customer service agents should not be fired on the spot!!!!!!  at one point they told me I should contact BORD GAIS to help me.. actually bord gais (although they have nothing to do with the issue) might be more helpful than your customer service team. Expect a 1 star review!!!
Please  I need help. I ve sent you a private message. Thanks.

Help. Tesco Photos. I placed an order with Tesco Photo on the 11th December was told 8 days deluvery and i have not teceived my order. I have used the contact page on tesco photos but no one has got back to me and there is no phone number. Really not happy.

just wanted to say thank you tesco...... yesterday our home delivery was suppose to come between 5-6pm  knowing how busy it is we were not surprised it did not come in time we waited for 30 minutes before ringing. i spoke to a lovely lady who informed me they were having issues and my shopping would be with me around  after 8.30 if that was ok i said yes she sent a ¬£5 voucher to say sorry.. at 8.30 pm i  got a call from a very lovely driver telling me he was 10 minutes away he went through all our subs and missing items and was very happy not rushing even tho he had lots more homes to go to  ... we did not mind waiting we totally understood but we wanted to say thank you to the driver and the lady at your call centre for all there help

Dear Tesco. You have one of your mega stores in Cradley Heath. This happens to be right oposite Wild Acre Rescue who I know would be extremely grateful for any surplus pet food you might have.    Giving back to the community and all that.   Just saying.
Bring back Rasberry Sorbet ...

Ordered click and collect minecraft and a dvd on Sunday evening for it to be delivered Tuesday to a local store. Kept tracking online and that kept saying it had been despatched and on way. With it still saying the same this morning I decided to ring to check as was getting concerned.  Will who I spoke to was lovely and rang the store it was meant to be going to. He then called me back explaining it had been lost in transit  he offered me a replacement that should come tomorrow. However  with it being near Christmas there is no guarantee. Very disappointed I wasn t contacted yesterday to be told the situation as surely it can t go unnoticed? Cannot find the game and dvd locally in time so fingers crossed it comes before Christmas as will have a very disappointed child.

Just a message to say if you are disabled and require help don t bother shopping here. My mum visited your Bellshill store the other day with my 26 year old disabled sister in her wheelchair to do a bit of shopping only to discover that the trolleys weren t suitable for attaching to her particular wheelchair. Instead of coming home my mum took her and trolley into shop and broke her back pushing a heavy wheelchair and pulling a trolley full behind her and not one member of staff offered any sort of asssistance.  I find that absolutely appalling. The only help my mum received was when she was leaving store going back to car in which a gentleman who was a customer saw her struggling and took trolley to car for her. Really bad customer service....nowhere near as good as M&S where one of the stores employees went around the shop with my mum and a trolley and then helped pack her bags and load shopping Into car. Will be shopping in M&S in future. There customer service is far superior to yourselves

Tesco today i received my xmas shop ( only 10 mins late ) two subs on the order   one of which i sent back with the driver along with 2 bottles of 4 pints of milk dated 26th  had to go to my local londis and guess what milk dated 3rd jan  why cant you do the same  but i YET AGAIN had an out of date item delivered tesco single cream 600 ml dated 21st  phoned customer services again and spoke to a nice lady with a board west country accent  didnt catch her name who organiosed a refund along with the dip dated 25th when on your website says 1 + week not on the short date section of my invoice neither was the milk  now this is the third time in the last year i have been sent an out of date item and this ladys repose of i dont know what to say to you is really not good enough  also to be cheeky where was my freebie ??

How come my friend got a free hamper/gift with her online delivery order of ¬£52 ...I spend ¬£103.70 get my delivery (with 6 items unavailable ) and I don t get a free hamper/gift why can t I have one ....Tesco you are useless

Huge thank you to the staff at Tesco Llandrindod Wells today. Not sure of their names sorry. My 21 month old grandson Tommy fell  and banged his head in the foyer of the store (little darling was doing a runner from me). I went to ask if they had a cold compress and they appeared with cooling pads  peas and sweets (which went down very nicely thanks).  Someone also found a local GP who was shopping in the store and he took a look at him.They were all so lovely and helpful. He s fine now but will probably have a nice bruise for Christmas. Thanks to all and Merry Christmas xx

Did you know that the text message and email from Tesco Direct telling you that your order is ready to collect is auto generated and completely meaningless because it s sent without actually checking stock levels  order status or parcel location. Tesco Direct  you well and truly suck and I can t trust you to ever order from you again. I placed my order. They took my money. On Monday unknown to me they started processing a refund. On Tuesday I got my email and text telling me I could collect from my local store. In Wednesday I planned to collect but decided to do it Thursday. Today I get an email stating my  requested  refund is being processed. Two phone calls later I have no parcel to collect  a 5 (presumably working) day wait for my refund and a pathetic apology with no logical or reasonable explanation for their stupid lying system.

Morning Tesco.  As you will be aware Christmas is stressful enough. So as I sat myself on the floor  glass of wine next to me to ease the pain of wrapping present  scissors and cellotape at the ready.  I got started wrapping with lovely looking paper I d bought from your store.  Well it s like painting the forth Road bridge! Sodding cellotape doesn t stick to said lovely paper and when it does 10mins later it s popped off! I got about a dozen presents wrapped last night which took forever. Put them under the tree and low and behold they have all popped open this morning.   I am now going to have to go buy more wrapping paper and start again. 6 sodding rolls of the stuff I bought. It s completely not fit for purpose and I didn t have enough wine in the house to deal with its capers.  Oh and to top it off there is sodding glitter everywhere from it! My house looks like a unicorn has farted all over it! Merry Christmas Tesco.

Isn t wonderful that Tesco is so caring it s just a shame this is all an advert to promote a service that they can t provide. Tesco you have for the second time this year with my second online shopping manage to disappoint yet again. Waited in last night for my online delivery - no call  no text  no email to say if it was late  if you couldn t deliver - NOTHING! I call you  wait 40mins to get through to someone to be told- sorry we can t deliver when we said we would (surprise surprise) and we can t contact anyone to re arrange the delivery. We will try to speak to someone tomorrow!!! Really Tesco? Is this the best you can do? I have 11 people to feed Saturday and guests arriving tonight and no food because I trusted you (foolish of me perhaps) to deliver at home all the food and drink that I need for the coming days. I have to work today and I am left with an empty fridge....and to all of that you can only say sorry?!???? Really!!! What about the fact that you should care about your customers and the promises you make and not simply be prepared to take their money? You re busy? You can t get to all of the deliveries? Well that is your problem and not mine - don t make so many slots available  employee more drivers and put your customers first!! I m fuming and so annoyed that now due to you lack of care and lack to provide a service I need to go to another supermarket at some point later tonight to try to do a shop that already took me hours to carefully  select on your website.  Very poor and I shall never ever buy with Tesco again! You should be ashamed of letting your customers down like you have!!!
Got my Tesco shopping delivery yesterday. No substitutions  really long use by dates  arrived on time  nothing missing and delivered by a very smiley delivery driver. Well done Tesco Wellingborough.

Decided to come to Tesco in Boston early to beat the rush  went to buy some Pitta bread and was shocked to find it goes out of date tomorrow. Do they not think that people don t go shopping every day.

Hi tesco.  Had my good shop last night delivered about 8.40pm. My mince pies (bakery fresh one) were damaged.
