Also most of my shopping was wet  seemingly by the smell it was covered in vinegar. Thankfully nearly every thing was in boxes or plastic wrapping but my fridge now smells like a pickle factory!

Please thank the staff in Tesco express at St. George s wharf  Vauxhall  London for holding onto my card when I stupidly left it in the self service till yesterday lunchtime.  Went back in a panic last night and was so grateful they had it safe for me!

I know it s a busy time of year but come on!!!!

Fuming Tesco!!!!! Booked a delivery timeslot went through ordering all my food then you gave it away to someone else!! Impossible doing a big xmas shop on my own with a toddler when i dont drive.... nice one tesco ...

Absolutely disgusted by your service tonight.  Our food shop should have arrived between 10-11pm which we paid ¬£7 delivery charge for that slot and it has not arrived! My husband phoned your Broughton shop where our shop comes from to be told it s due to the driver running out of time.  Absolutely poor customer service!

Tesco store  Bishops Cleeve. Cheltenham.   I would just like to say a huge thank you to the lovely lady who has helped me in store this evening. I very stupidly didn t find out her name  and I m sorry for that  because she really does deserve recognition for her assistance tonight.  I did the bulk of my Christmas food shop this evening  but when I paid  half of the club card vouchers I have saved all year  didn t work. The till said they had already been redeemed. I haven t used them  so was more than a little gutted at the prospect of losing out on ¬£47.50 worth of vouchers coming off my bill.  The lady took me to customer services and phoned through to clubcard helpline to try and sort it out.  The lady on the phone was also lovely and did all she could to sort it out for me  but just as we were getting somewhere  the fire alarm in their building started going off and she had to abort my call.  At this point  the helpful lady in store said she would put the vouchers through somehow for me  as I had my children with me and there was no way of knowing how long we may have to wait for the club card lady to call back as promised  if they were being evacuated for a fire alarm.  I really am very pleased and have come away feeling valued as a customer.  Credit where credit is due. People are all too quick to complain these days  but not so forthcoming with praise...and the members of staff that helped me tonight all deserve praise and recognition.  Thank you. üôÇ Merry Christmas üéÑ

Just want to say a big thank you to your stairfoot Barnsley store tonight. The staff were lovely despite it being busy and trying to stock the shelves. Especially Richard who was stocking the drinks. He was really helpful and ran in the back to grab us J2os. It s a busy time of year and it s the best customer service I ve received in recent week! Thanks tesco.

i would like to inform people of the current scam i have experienced by tesco direct.   placed an order on the 15th dec for  a toy for my son for xmas in the 1/3 off sale.  six days later the day before it was due to arrive the order was CANCELLED  as being out of stock.  The next day the item was interestingly back in stock  telephoned tesco direct  to order but they refused to honour the sale price!!  line manager refused to give her name stating she didn t have to due to terms and conditions!!    Disgusting!!!  have left an autistic boy without the toy that was ordered for him for xmas!!!     will be cancelling my tesco groceries account and will never spend another penny in Tesco ever again!!!     people should be aware the sort of company that tesco is  they have had my money for six days and won t be refunding my money to my card for another five days   and won t be sending the toys either   thanks tesco cos every penny counts at xmas!!!!

My Christmas delivery has just been  it was expected between 9&10  so a bonus already it came at 9. What a lovely delivery driver Richard was  very patience helpful and chatty  little things like Richards excellent customer service makes me think I shall be changing supermarkets.

What can I say Tesco  I am so upset and disappointed that yet again you failed to deliver my christmas dinner that I can have on Chrsitmas day  7 major items go out of date from tomorrow to the 23rd  no items I can freeze and no items I can feed my family that are slightly out of date  unless I want to give them food poisoning. I am writing this to let people know what has happened with my Christmas Tesco home delivery ordernthis evening.  Tesco will remove this very quickly no doubt.   Ordered over 4 weeks ago and due to arrive between 5-6pm today. At 6.30  no delivery  so called help number.  Held in a queue for about 3-5 minutes. The lady I spoke to I have absolutely no complaints about at all. I was informed that my order was going to be late  approx 4 hours. So potentially arriving by 10pm. I  at this point had received no communication whatsoever about the delay.  When I asked why none had contacted me  I was firstly said that a text had been sent to my mobile number. When I said it hadn t  then was told that it was sent to my work s landline. Not possible  as nothing was recorded.   I spent  over the 2 phone calls  approximately 30 mins speaking and holding. I refused the offer of the order being delivered by 10pm  so asked for the order to be cancelled. It was a large Christmas order  so it would take me about 1.5 hours to unpack.  I was then informed that a van had broken down earlier. These things do happen  but I was not informed of any delay. I am distraught. Tesco did offer to deliver tomorrow  but I am away from home all day  so noone at home to take delivery. How could they possibly promise this  as they are fully booked and this would mean letting another customer down which  found totally unacceptable and unfair.   Tesco are refunding me the money already taken off my card  but was informed that this would take between 2-5 days to reach my account. Not good enough  as I know I can pay by BACS and the money is transferred  usually  the same day.  Therefore  I will now have to go out on Christmas Eve to shop and pay for another shopping  as the money taken by Tesco will not have been refunded at that point. The home delivery service was a treat so I wouldn t have to do this.  When I pointed this out the obvious problem  I was informed that it would take 2 days. Still not any good  re expensive time of the year. Money doesn t grow on trees.   I honestly think Tesco have over booked  putting money ahead of customer satisfaction and think they have the edge  as customers won t cancel their orders because they have no choice. We do have the choice.  Poor Tesco employees  - customer services  pickers  packers  drivers. All who have had problems today and I am only 1 customer.  Tonight the driver will have to unpack the crates and pickers will spend a few hours putting food back on shelves. Hope the frozen food is put back in freezers immediately or will not be fit to eat and same for fridge food. It may have to be put in a skip!   Not good enough Tesco. Bitterly disappointed. You have lost a loyal customer for good. Christmas plans have been spoilt at his end.  I had everything in hand and was starting relax. Merry Christmas

I have to say  I am absolutely appalled with Tesco Direct and their level of empathy and service.   I started my Christmas shopping in August  when you had a huge toy sale on. I spent nearly ¬£150  ¬£75 of which was my son s main present  a Ninja Turtles sewer lair. I collected the order on the 31st of August and immediately took them to a relative s house so that I wasn t tempted to give them to my son for his birthday  which I had already finished buying for.  Fast forward  I picked the boxes (2 in total) up from the house and opened them to wrap them last night and there was no sewer lair in sight. One box had 8 items in  which were dispatched together. However  the second box should have had two items in  as they were dispatched together  and it didn t. I wasn t given the ¬£75 main present.  I went to my local store and they called Tesco direct. I was told it was solely my responsibility and they categorically would not do anything. Just what you want 4 days before Christmas. I then spoke to a manager  who was just as stern  again  my fault. I believe it is fairly obvious the reason why I am only contacting Tesco now  but apparently that is my fault and my fault alone.  I ended up putting the phone down as we were going round in circles. Thanks a lot Tesco  one four year old boy s main present down.

Thank you Tesco for ruining mine and my mum s Christmas.    My mother ordered shopping from you to be delivered last night for over Christmas. Money is tight this year so she had saved her Clubcard vouchers for  The big Christmas shop . Both of us were really looking forward to having food for over Christmas. BUT she received a phone call last night to say that her shopping will not be delivered as her bank had declined payment. She was very confused about this as she had made sure there was enough money in the bank to pay for our food. The shopping had come to just over ¬£160  but was reduced by ¬£60 with the club vouchers that has been saved over the year. Tesco had told her that to make payment she would have to have the full amount the shopping came to before the vouchers being applied!!!!! This doesn t make sense as if you would go to a shop to have the exact same food and use the vouchers  you wouldn t need over ¬£160 to spend on shopping that only comes to ¬£100 with vouchers!!!  The delivery for the food was supposed to be between 4 and 5  Tesco had phoned at 3:40! in my eyes this is a very late to let your customers know that the food shop will not be delivered  and at this time of the year only being 5 days away from Christmas  this short notice is not enough. Now we will have to go food shopping in a mad rush to try and get some food for over the Christmas period. And with shops being manic and a stressful place to be in  the last thing I wanted to do was to go shopping for food  when it SHOULD  have been delivered to us.   This has left us both stressed  upset  without food and angry due to what has happened. We have always done our shopping with you  and we have always gotten our Christmas shopping delivered to us. We are not impressed at all with this situation.   So a BIG thank you  to you Tesco. Have a Merry Christmas  and a Happy New Year!

Just wanted to give a positive shout out to my Tesco delivery driver this morning (I have good experiences with Tesco deliveries generally).  His name was John (he s a grandfather) and he was SUCH a lovely man! Deserved a medal for lugging my Christmas food shop up the path (I m catering for my sister s 40th on 27th so lumped that food in too - immense!). He did it with a huge smile on his face  a big hello  a lovely little chat with my 4 year old. He didn t rush me in unpacking and made sure I was really happy with everything. I only had 1 substitution out of 77 items (never have more than one or two on any order!).  When it was time to go  he asked me out of earshot of my LO if it was ok to give her a chocolate lolly as a little present  making sure she didn t have any allergies etc (he had fruit lollies as a back up just in case!). He asked if we had any more children and left one for my son as well. The nicest part though..... he d bought them himself to take out on his rounds this week for all the children  out of his own pocket!!  Please let him know how lovely he is. I did ring your customer service line and tell them what a great ambassador he is for your company but not sure if it gets passed on.  I presume he works in Pitsea store as I m advised that s where home deliveries come from to the Southend area.  Thank you John for brightening up my day! X

Dear Tesco    Firstly thanks for potentially running my step kids Christmas‚Ä¶‚Ä¶..  We placed an order for the one present they really wanted back in October which was a trampoline   We collected this from the Brownhills store and took it home assuming that a top 5 retail giant would ship items correctly. A few weeks later for some reason I checked the box and found that the order had been picked incorrectly  The trampoline comes in 2 parts  box 1 and box 2 however rather than send one of each box they had sent 2 box ones meaning we had 2 trampolines but no instructions  safety netting or other important parts.  We took this back to the store and returned both boxes as advised (no problem  mistakes happen) expecting to receive a new trampoline.  When the new delivery arrived  again it was wrong ‚Äì two box ones had again been sent  Back it goes again  3rd time lucky!  3rd delivery arrived ‚Äì you‚Äôve guessed it exactly the same again‚Ä¶‚Ä¶.  Now I appreciate mistakes happen  we all make them  but to take the same mistake 3 times is an absolute joke  Now this is where I start to get really annoyed‚Ä¶‚Ä¶  We are now being told the item is out of stock and have been asked if we want a refund. WHAT USE IS A REFUND 4 DAYS BEFORE CHRISTMAS?  I‚Äôve spoken to numerous people in the Brownhills store who have been really helpful  but when they ring to try and rectify it they just keep getting fobbed of  my fianc√© has rang the customer service line and again been fobbed off with ‚Äòyou can have a refund or wait till the item is back in stock‚Äô ‚Äì that‚Äôs great customer service adviser  are you going to come round and explain to the kids Christmas morning?  I‚Äôve just got off the phone to the head office customer service number  the guy I spoke to (Usman) was again really helpful and apologetic but couldn‚Äôt resolve the issue for me.  I‚Äôm now awaiting a phone call from Usman‚Äôs supervisor Nicola to ring me back  being honest I can see what will happen ‚Äì I will be offered a refund that‚Äôs if I even get a call  I‚Äôve suggested a simple solution ‚Äì if the 8 foot trampoline is out of stock  send me the 10 foot one ‚Äì yes I know it‚Äôs more expensive but surely ¬£30/40 isn‚Äôt going to hurt after all of the hassle I‚Äôve been through  Not once have I been offered any sort of compensation for the hassle I‚Äôve been through or the cost I‚Äôve incurred in petrol and phone calls  let alone the time I‚Äôve waster ‚Äì GREAT CUSTOMER SERVICE‚Ä¶.  So Tesco  you‚Äôve got 3 days to avoid 2 kids Christmas‚Äôs being wrecked by your utter incompetence and also save a customer who spends ¬£400/¬£500 a month with you ‚Äì Do you think you can rise to this challenge ‚Äì Personally I‚Äôm not convinced‚Ä¶‚Ä¶  Finally Tesco  ask yourself this question‚Ä¶.What would you and your buying team be saying/doing if a supplier had delivered something wrong 3 times in a row and then weren‚Äôt resolving the issue in a satisfactory fashion?   #Tesco #Operationalshambles #whathappenedtoputtingthecustomerfirst

Hello Tesco   I visited your branch @ the Mayflower Retail Park Basildon (A127) yesterday with my 4 month old baby boy... Firstly I must say how impressed I was with the helpfulness / friendliness of staff and how all the shelves were being restocked to capacity despite the vast number of people in store. No sooner than I had selected two packets of pastry  was someone refilling the gap! Altho it was busy  the experience wasn t a hellish as id imagined! Your carpark on the other hand.... As mentioned in a mum of a small baby so spent 15 minutes driving around waiting for a mum&child spot to become free. You only have a few so I know it was a long shot! I gave in and parked in the widest spot I could find. Struggled to free the baby from his car seat without knocking the car next to me and went inside. Upon returning to my car I was now parked next to another car clearly with children inside (visible car seats & toys) and you ve guessed it  I ve been  dinged  while I m annoyed  I can totally understand how it happened so can t be too angry at that poor mum / dad. There I am  fighting and struggling to get my baby safely back into his car seat without causing damage and not one but THREE couples are retuning to cars parked in the mother&child spaces! I let the first one side  the second I shot a look and when the third made a comment about how tight the spaces were and to be careful  I d had enough.   It is when people park in the mum&baby  spots all the time  - I said with a smile! This Middle aged couple  no baby or child  were parked in a space specifically wider for loading / unloading small people  the 40 something year old lady looked and me and shouted  oh f*ck off  I quickly looked around in search of an employee or anyone incase things turned nasty but as no one was around I finished loading my baby and left.  I understand you can t stop these kinds of obnoxious  self centred people visiting your store but maybe some form of carpark patrol might be in order?!  You d be quick enough to ticket someone parked in a disabled spot without the correct permit  so maybe a gentle remind to those using the mum&baby spots that they are there to HELP mums  not save their nice car doors!   Mum & baby spots are hard enough to come by at the best of times I know  but a little consideration from others world go a long way for mums and their children.
You have done it AGAIN!!!! Taken my grocery for online order out twice!! Your Ayelsham branch is incompetent!!! Right before Christmas! Cheers for that!

took out life insurance on the 13th nov and get a  free 75 gift card. turns out i wont be getting it for months!!! gotta pay 4 premiums to recieve a 50 quid gift card and then after paying another 3 months get the other 25 bit stupid really as it stated on tge life insurance leaflet that you would recieve 75 quid for taking out life insurance with you. im not that bothered but it would of been nice if it was stated in the leaflet thats how it works!!! x

What do I do now??? Am I going to have to go into store to do my Christmas shop now? Because that won t be Tesco  I can assure you.

I recently purchased a laptop on Tesco direct. It was through a partner company who are allowed to sell on Tesco website. They are called Box.co.uk. I ve been a loyal Tesco shopper for many years so didn t see a problem with this  Tesco are a trusted name and I ve never had any problems with Tesco in the past. It was a click and collect purchase which was meant to be delivered to a local store. I had all the details  just had to wait for an email to say the store had received the item. On the day of delivery I received a call from the delivery driver of a well documented firm who s name begins with a Y and ends in odel. This was the first warning sign  how could Tesco use such an inept company to safely deliver their parcels?? The driver said he could not find my house... I had to explain to him that he was meant to deliver to a Tesco store and I would collect it. He said he d do it. I awaited the email to inform me that I could collect the item but it never arrived in my inbox. I decided to go to the store anyway  after all - I d been told by the delivery driver that my parcel would be delivered that day. Got to the store and they could not find the item. Another warning sign. I explained the situation  what the item was and where it had come from and eventually they located it. I took it home and presented it to my fianc√©e as her lovely new laptop for her birthday. She opened it up and switched it on only to find that the text on screen was Italian. Another warning sign. No worries I thought  just change the language to English. Well  the keyboard has numerous Italian symbols (letters with accents) and the other symbols (@  ?  etc) are all in the wrong place so do not correspond with what you type. I called Tesco direct who did not help in the slightest. They told me to  google  box. Box? I said. Yes  Box she said. It will come up on google and you ll have to deal with them. Another warning sign... I started to get a little worried. I googled box only to find hundreds of results which had nothing to do with who I was looking for. Another warning sign. Anyway  I eventually found their website. They don t have a telephone number for customer service  only for sales who do not deal with anything after the point of sale. Another warning sign. I read some reviews and immediately regretted ever buying through Tesco direct  I won t make this mistake again in a hurry. I eventually found a  call back request  form which I fully completed. This was over a week ago and I m yet to speak to anyone at box. I have however had email correspondence with someone. She emails me one day  I respond  then I receive an answer a full 24hrs later  then I respond and the cycle continues... Its been over a week and my complaint had not moved very far at all. She told me she s arranged for dpd to collect the laptop as they need to inspect it. Collection was arranged for Monday 19th between 9-5... My fianc√©e took the day off work but nobody arrived to collect it. I had to email three times to get a response to which they said  sorry about that . I have lost all confidence in Tesco and have had this foreign laptop (not described like this on Tesco direct!!) since 9th December. That is a complete disgrace. I have pleaded with box for a refund but they are not playing ball. I paid for it using my Tesco credit card and I d like a refund ASAP so that I can find a replacement laptop before Christmas. For anyone reading this  please be careful when buying from Tesco direct. You are not always buying from Tesco but from some cowboy company that they have partnered with. I m shocked that Tesco would allow themselves to be associated with these companies who s customer service is appalling  along with the reviews!!
Tesco why are you removing my partner Natasha Giles posts ?

4 days before Christmas  building a Batman bike for my son  pedal doesn t fit as the fitting is to small? Customer service can t offer replacement part or new bike as not in stock! After some persuasion I manage to get a refund  but does not really help me with the dilemma of having no bike to give my 3 year old on Christmas morning! Bought when bikes were on offer so I ll also be massively out of pocket having to buy full/overpriced bike! Happy Christmas Tesco!

Hi  I m a regular at one of your branches and I ve just witnessed a member of staff throwing out bread  croissants other pastry items. I asked him if he would give them to a shelter or food banks he let me know that it was a against your policy to give away food that was not bought and now the bins that they are thrown in to are locked as to deter people from trying to do so. I am horrified at the fact that a huge corporation doesn t do anything to help it s most vulnerable members of the community when it clearly has the resources and means to; that a corporation would rather see a waste in food than see it s local people fed. Is there actually a policy on the preference to throw food away rather than save it for those who could use and benefit from it (referring to the assumed masses of food not just surrounding pastry goods providing it doesn t cause harm)? Thanks  Rachael.

Hello   My mother and I would like to thank your High Wycombe town centre branch. Particularly two members who were stacking the Christmas gift section yesterday evening (19/12). My mother works at John Radcliffe Hospital and as a last minute idea she was granted a budget to go and buy gifts for the patients on the ward that she works on. We spotted the Lynx Africa sets were on offer which were perfect and in budget so we cleared the shelf  when a staff member asked if we would need any more as she had lots more stock. We said yes please to some more and asked if they had anything for the females  as there was little stock out  she said that she would go and have a look. Two members of staff returned with a whole crate of Lynx and Nivea gift options. We took 20 of the Nivea gifts and 14 Lynx sets.  Would just like to say thank you to those two  unfortunately we didn t catch names but they were MOST helpful in providing us gifts and they went above and beyond.  Merry Christmas!  Naomi and Carol

I had the misfortune  of buying tes cos classic kitchen Beef in Peppercorn Sauce..Firstly according to the packet I was expecting  greens and potatoes  to accompany  the beef. This wasn t the case. On opening  the packet it cardboard sleeve  I saw a huge amount if cream sauce with very small amounts of beef. On tasting  the beef  I discovered  that the beef had the consistency of pre chewed  and spat out beef chunks  while the sauce was without any flavour whatsoever. I think dog food would have looked and tasted better. I hope you review this ready meal item to make it more palatable to anyone else that chooses this item for dinner.  I  am a very disappointed customer.

What an absolute joke. You sent my click and collect item to the wrong store. And without asking  you refunded me because the wrong store rejected the item. Now the item is out of stock leaving my daughter on Christmas day without the doll she wanted. What a joke!!!!

Have to say  had some lousy service from British companies in this last year (many of which have had to compensate for their incompetence) but Tesco Groceries has been a rare exception. Not happy with my glittery rudolph wrapping paper looks lovely but comes unstuck :(

What I saved in your online deals  paid for in trying to collect an item from Bonnybridge express! Husband collected item with order number and ID as requested in order email. So got my online shop delivered today and had a lovlely driver who helped me But when I checked the bank I noticed you took 2 payments for the shop  I rang the number provided to be told you dont do that and that one may be a pending payment and one may be the actual payment And I need to cal back tomorrow to arrange a refund As they cant see it on the system for 24 hours  then the refund can take 3-5 working days so most likely after christmas That money was for me to attend hospital to check on my unborn child  I am very upset over this as I have to go hospital weekly now I cant which means I am unable to check the growth etc of my child  the woman was of no help what so ever and would not help me with my money at all  Disgusted and distraught pregnant lady here

I would just like to say how touched I am with the deputy manager at the express store in Aldeburgh.  We have a lady and her young son come in to the store most days and she is not having a very easy time of it  her partner is in the hospice with a brain tumour and won t be out for some time. The deputy manager  (Becky Hendricks) made up a Christmas hamper for her and her family. This was such a kind and thoughtful gesture   it makes me proud to work with such a lovely person. So a big thank u and we ll done to becky and tesco.

So today I decided to do the Xmas food shop. I always shop at tesco Seacroft. Despite seeing cheaper vegetables for Christmas advertised else where  I still came to you. BUT I am most dissatisfied that all your so called Xmas deals on vegetables where with sell by dates of 22nd December!! I as a loyal customer had to buy the more expensive produce which would be indate on Christmas day. Surely not many people cook a full roast this week on the lead up to Xmas?

Had an email today from your so called customer services informing me that you are refusing to return my money after the oven I ordered was not delivered as promised on 12 Dec 2016.  The order has been cancelled in writing and on the telephone as 28th December is not before Christmas as you seem to think.  Before Christmas 2017 maybe but we need an oven this year.  Anyway what makes you think you will get away with keeping the money if you have not supplied the goods which you have admitted???  A dispute has been raised with Barclaycard regarding the charge and their legal dept are on the case meanwhile I am also going to report you to Trading standards and ActionFraud.

I note a huge amount of negativity on this page from visitor posts and would just like to say I had my shopping delivered at the weekend (on time as always) and by a lovely delivery person (as always) and along with my shopping there was an unexpected Christmas treat from Tesco which will keep Rudolph  Santa  mum  dad and two kids very happy on Christmas Eve! So basically I just wanted to say THANK YOU and Merry Christmas!

We ordered this item over 7 days on Tesco Photo   When logging in to find out where the item is the website keeps kicking us out and asking us to login besides doing so multiple times.  After searching through your legal documentation we found a phone number which tells us to email rather than speaking to someone and get the issue resolved.   This is utterly appalling service  the item we ordered has not been received  when finding out where it is we get logged out and when trying to phone we get fobbed off!  Where is our item?
Hi tesco  Just wondering if you price match with any other retailers?

Ordered an online delivery Sunday morning for that evening  slot of 7pm to 8pm. No delivery came. A whole hour and 22mins after my delivery slot I received a phone call to say that the driver hadn t turned up. I was offered a reschedule to then be told there were no more slots until after Christmas  my only option was a refund and a good will voucher of ¬£15. I wasn t offered the option on pick and collect at my local store! My reason for ordering online is because I m 38 weeks pregnant and I m having hip pain  not so easy to walk and do a food shop! I was left with no shopping and having to wait up to 3 days for my refund. Pretty poor customer service  why wasn t I called before my scheduled delivery slot? I used to work in retail and know that a driver has to be there well before his/her first drop to do van checks and then load. Instead of calling before they left it until 9:22pm. Unacceptable. I wasn t called then until mid Monday morning to say a special van would be coming out to deliver my shopping. Same delivery slot  it then was 15mins later than my allotted time! I ve been charged a further ¬£2.00!! And not forgetting I m actually missing 2 items from my shopping! Not happy at all! You need to sort your customer service management out! A call should have come out before my delivery slot and I should have at least been offered pick and collect! Not so sure I trust to use your services again!

TESCO..... I can t belive my daughter isn t going to get her main present for Christmas thanks to you Tesco! I ordered the peppa pig playhouse kitchen last week and was going to be delivered on Fri last week... to be told it s delayed and would be delivered on Monday.  I hiave now been told it s lost and no more in stock. I payd the price of ¬£30 on offer and considering they say it s out of stock it is now on YOUR website but at ¬£88 pound. Talk about scam! Then all you can say is sorry shall I refund you. You ve ruined my Christmas. It s my 2 year old main present which I saved for.. I m on a limited budget n have spent all my other money so can t even buy elsewhere. Is there any justice! Please help as iv never been so dissapointed.

Very disappointed with your Brie Parcels from your Christmas delivery.  Main ingredient is ONION?  They are listed as BRIE parcels with an onion chutney.  I know that onion is a lot cheaper than brie so i guess this is your way to make a bigger profit but I think its crappy.   I generally love your food and this was supposed to be my Christmas treat. Very unhappy and disappointed customer now.

I ve just been to your store and spent just under ¬£400 on a T.V as I ve gone to leave the store the security guy stopped me and ask to see my recipt like am trying to steel the the T.V. I noticed he wasn t randomly stopping other shoppers and demanding to see there recipt or going thru there shopping? If you have no way to mark larger goods so you know it s been payed for maybe a member of staff could have used a couple of mins of there time to walk me out rather than treating me like am on the rob. You don t win a prize if you can guss where I won t be making any future big purchas.
¬£60 price difference a couple of days after purchasing not impressed tesco feels like daylight robbery

I haven t done it for a long time but with the lead up to Christmas I thought I d stock up on some cheap ready meals. The design and ease of your frozen range is so good! With the easy pull to open and peelable lid I can imagine it being really good for elderly or someone who is struggling to cater for them self but still wants independence so well done tesco!

Well  merry Christmas to the manager and staff working in Tesco at the Easthey road   Portsmouth shop.... have just bought two packs of paracetamol tablets and paid 64p  yet paid 60p for exactly the same product in the larger branch at Fratton park.  Haven t compared every item in the store  but the online price is also 30p per packet. It s not much of a difference  I agree  but shouldn t really happen in a trader with their reputation for quality and pricing competitiveness.

Yesterday  I visited Tesco on the Wrekin Retail Park  Telford where I saw a coffee machine on display. As I couldn t find one boxed  I looked round for someone to assist me. After going round the entire top floor twice  in my wheelchair  I joined the queue at the tills where I was told that there was no one else. The assistant closed her till and came with me to try to find a coffee machine. She eventually went to the store to try to locate one but returned to say there were none in stock. Why are items on display if they are not available? I know I could have tried online but I didn t want to do that. Last time I ll be going to that store. I ll get my coffee maker elsewhere. Bad service.

Would just like to say how impressed we were as a family when shopping at the very busy Tesco trostre parc in Llanelli. All staff  although busy were smiley but a special thanks to the young boy on tills - Adrian I think his name was who took time to help me pack bags  chat away to my two little ones and generally really polite manner made my shopping trip so much more enjoyable than anticipated! Thank you Tesco!

I have a order booked for delivery before Xmas on the 23rd. Every day I pop back to add more items to my order only to be informed more of the Christmas items Iver ordered are no longer available. What is the point in having last minute slots if all the food is unavailable? I m now left with no free from Christmas items. It s ment to make the Christmas shop easy and stress free which is definitely not the case this year!
After over twenty years of doing nearly all my everyday shopping at Tesco  I m regretfully looking for another supermarket. My local Tesco has discontinued too many of the products I like to buy. :(

As a mum of 4 children we go through a lot of bread in a week so I was so glad when tesco started doing their stay fresh loafs. A lovely soft loaf that was very reasonably priced at 55p. But over the last few weeks it has changed for the worse. Its not lovely and soft anymore and tastes more like the value bread or 3 day old bread when I have just bought it. Getting more and more disappointed with Tesco and only go their for a few items now adays and travel the 34 mile round trip to shop at aldi instead

I tried to put this complaint about your mobile phone to you via your system but it wouldn t let me put it all down due to a character limit that was not clear before I started the complaint so I ve put it here instead. I m not happy with the fact that an order I placed for a phone was cancelled by your system but that I was not informed of this  instead  receiving a  track your order  email from yourself. Then I had a problem with your phone enquiry line because it takes absolutely ages of clicking through all the available options (up to 10 choices) before I could even speak to anyone about it  & the first person couldn t even locate the order. I  then went online to check myself  & found out that my order that I have been waiting for since 30 Nov had been cancelled. Why didn t the first person find that information for me? I rang again & clicked thru all the options to speak to someone who put me on  hold for more than 5 minutes. I rang again & went thru all the options and the woman I spoke to could see the cancelled order - she was the one who confirmed that the order was cancelled by the system  but she couldn t tell me why Tesco had not  informed me of the cancellation. She recommended I went into the store to buy the phone & put me through to the phone shop but it was reverting to the Tesco mobile line. When I rang customer services (all I wanted to do was check whether the phone I wanted was in stock  she said  well it is a week before Christmas.  I know that. But I ordered my phone in Nov! She could not get through so I have now to go into the shop (a week before xmas) not knowing if  the phone is in the shop.1 1/2 hours wasted & there isn t enough space here 2 mk cmplnt!

Feeling a bit disappointed  Tesco. I placed an order for home delivery and as soon as I paid (part debit card  part clubcard vouchers)  got a message saying the items wouldn t arrive when I wanted them. Immediately phoned to cancel or change the order to collection but your staff couldn t help me. I cancelled the order myself  and understood the refund of cash and vouchers would take place in 3-5 working days. In the meantime  I reordered items and have since collected these.   So.....today  9 working days later  still no refund. Your member of staff today has been helpful  and found that in fact the funds were never claimed by Tesco  but are still held as  reserved  at my bank. I have lost my clubcard vouchers until Feb 2017  so a refund of the amount spent on them has been made. The bank are being asked to release my funds....all because  apparently  I cancelled TOO QUICKLY!  I m told that the money will be back with me today or tomorrow  and that I will be reimbursed for the cash value of the vouchers I used (but not their enhanced value if used on certain offers). It hasn t left me feeling very Christmassy  I m afraid. As you like to say   every little helps  (what DOES that mean?) perhaps someone in your customer relations department might have something to make me feel a bit less disgruntled?

Hi Tesco  I went to check my bank balance today to find that one payment of ¬£90 has been taken out but another of the same amount is pending. Lucky enough I had enough money to cover the second ¬£90 but this is unacceptable! You have left me out of pocket (I have only ¬£10 left in my main account and have a bill to pay) on the run up to Christmas because your system has taken two payments from my bank account. I have to wait 24 plus hours to get my ¬£90 back but this should not be happening to your customers as we shop with you online and in store with confidence. I have informed my bank account and have informed Tesco of the error. I want people who shop with you to be wary of your system at the moment as fee s could be applied to those who end up in unplanned overdrafts when money is taken when it shouldn t be. Very disappointed Tesco!

Ordered a turkey crown  only by chance I went back on Saturday to add something else to my order to find they d took it out of my basket as non available so added more things to my order instead to take me over ¬£40 so service was free collected my order to find they d added 2 smaller turkey crowns instead (which I didn t want) these turkey crowns were ¬£9 each so ¬£18 for both looked at my receipt they d charged me ¬£23 for them and put pricematched as this was the price of the original turkey  told me they d refund that off my bill instantly  then found out they d not took off ¬£28.15 in clubcard vouchers and e-coupons  said they couldn t sort that I d have to ring up Tesco.com so ¬£73.45 went out of my bank this morning instead of ¬£22.30  got the refund for vouchers and coupons this morning but hadn t even sorted ¬£23 refund for turkey so 2 phone calls later I m out of pocket till it s sorted!!! Dear Tesco It s time to up your gain! Last year I spent a small fortune buying a Christmas turkey from you and was so suprised that so many were not British! Missing opportunity to support older shoppers or anyone who feels vulnerable using cashpoints. Stood waiting as lady paid at till. The lady asked if she could have ¬£20 cashback. Cashier  sorry you have to spend over ¬£20 and your shopping is only ¬£19:49. The lady explained as she has arthritis in her hands doesn t feel quick enough at ATM s. I gave cashier my ¬£1 veg  and the lady ¬£1.....only then could she have cash back. Wake up! I too have arthritis so as I age I will be that lady one day!

Tesco...how could you?  How could you design such cute wrapping paper.  With its cute reindeer and pretty sparkles  I fell for its charms.  This year with 3 older teens and a 4 year old to keep in suspense for their Christmas gifts  I decided I would wrap all present in the same gorgeous paper.  Well....now I fully regret my choice and wish I had not been lured in to the glittery trap.  I made the error of wrapping presents on my bed...huge mistake.  My room looked like an explosion in a glitter factory and even though I washed the covers and hoovered  yes hoovered my bed...my husband and I woke in the morning looking like Bradley and Ottavio from X-Factor.  I then had to do the school run and shopping with a very sparky face before I could even attempt to wash it off in the shower.  And that was only round one.  Round two  I thought I d put a sheet down first.  It saved the carpet but on shaking the sheet out side  I panicked that I would confuse dear old Rudolph himself into thinking Santa s clock might be late.  It s in my eyes  Tesco.  It s on my clothes and just about everywhere I look.    And guess where I work and what I have to sell everyday...TESCO!!! what strength it takes not to scream   DONT DO IT.  STAY AWAY FROM THE SPARKLES  to every customer that falls for its beauty.  I shall send you a bill for the extra washing and hoovering for both wrapping sessions and ...  OH MY GOODNESS!!!!  IT S ALL GOT TO COME BACK OFF ON CHRISTMAS DAY.  AHHHHHHHGGHHHHHHH!!!!!

Hello  today I visited your seacroft store for some Xmas shopping and then decided to go to the cafe to get my 2 year old son some lunch. I noticed that the menu had changed and sausages weren t an option but did notice that on the kids menu  you offered burger chips and peas. You also offered a full all day breakfast including sausages on the main menu. As my son is a fairly fussy eater and specifically asked for sausages  I asked the gent at the till if I could swap the burger for sausage(s) and got quite a blunt  no  in reply. He explained that till has no option to make changes to the meals and quite clearly wasn t prepared to speak to the chef to ask to ask the for sausage instead. I was really quite shocked that he refused to make the swap. I wasn t asking for anything for free and I was only asking for something that every other supermarket cafe does accommodate. Essentially  no parent can buy sausages for their children despite them having sausages available  or make any amendments to any meal on the menu due to the till. The gent I happened to speak was called Jason and his name badge stated he was the manager. I am surprised he will have any customers in his cafe if he speaks to customers the way I was spoken to. Needless to say  you won t be getting any further custom from me based on the poor menu choice and customer service.

Good morning  I have to send this message as a matter of urgency. I was in your store very recently (Blandford Forum super store).  I was horrified  (and trust me  not a lot rattles my cage ) to see that the AED (automated external defibrillator)  fitted inside the store  has been blocked off by a huge Christmas tree and  a charity collection box.  What on earth is the thinking in this?? This piece of life saving equipment has been virtually forgotten behind a huge box and a tree. I was filled full of dread. There were staff about but I just couldn t speak as I wanted to be taken seriously. So I m here :) If someone suffers a full cardiac arrest  you have four minutes before they ll suffer brain damage. Ten minutes before they are unsavable. CPR alone will not save a person s life. It s called basic life support for  a reason. It will support basic function  but without an ambulance  a paramedic  or a member of the public using one of these AEDs  (which thankfully you need no training for  as it will walk the user through) someone will die.  I know these AEDs have saved lives where otherwise there would have been no hope. Please  please  please get the tree and other things out of the way.  You wouldn t put a tree in front of a fire exit (I d hope!) This is the same.  Please sort it out <3 (Happy Christmas xxxxxxx)

I am absolutely horrified after purchasing a packet of Tesco ultra dry nappies this afternoon for my twins to discover they have both had what seems to be some sort of chemical burn/sores/blister reaction from them. I have always used pampers but this particular time we are away visiting family and as the Tesco store didn t have the size pampers I require in stock i purchased your own brand.  On the Tesco brand nappies it clearly states in bold pictures on the front of the Packet  soft against baby s skin  which clearly isn t the case as the wee that has been absorbed into the nappy has hardened into hard lumpy crystals that have caused sores and blisters on both my babies bottoms. One of the twins started screaming and was restraining herself from sitting down... once we took the nappy off it was clearly apparent straight away why she was in such discomfort as her bottom was red raw with skin pealing off  my daughter was screaming in agony! Her twin brother was also red raw but not as bad as his twin sister. We have put cream on both babies and purchased a packet of pampers and hope to see some improvement by the morning. We have taken photos for evidence and kept the nappies if you need these for further investigation.

Examples - ordered a pregnancy test kit and got condoms  no sprouts on Christmas order but delivery driver was limping after falling over sprouts by Tesco back door - you get the idea.... I called again yesterday  8th order  8th problem. I was promised this manager would DEFINITELY call back between 12 and 4 today. Guess what? No call. Do you value my custom that little that you cannot even be bothered to call back a loyal  high spending customer? I am appalled at that lack of service. Please. please get someone to call me and start delivering on promises. Yours  unhappy of Stotfold.

I was looking on the Red Cross website to donate for the Syrian crisis & came across this page - well done Tesco! Yet another reason to support YOU!   Tesco logo ¬© Info Tesco has supported us for the past decade. It has donated over ¬£10 million in financial support to our emergency appeals. The partnership began in 2007  when we were Tesco‚Äôs Charity of the Year. Since then  our engagement has deepened to include an emergency agreement that supports our work both in the UK and overseas. In the UK  our emergency response teams are able to request items from Tesco stores that help us support people in crisis. This can mean supplying pallets of bottled water to a Red Cross rest centre following an incident such as an evacuation from a block of flats or providing food for residents isolated in their homes by severe weather or flooding. Ten years after Tesco made a major donation following the Boxing Day tsunami in 2004  it became a founding member of the Disaster Relief Alliance ‚Äì a British Red Cross initiative. The Disaster Relief Alliance aims to bring about closer engagement with the private sector in our humanitarian activities  providing financial support before crises occur.

Very disappointed in the service I received in tesco extra Chesterfield today. Last January I purchased a Dyson from this store and today it stopped working so I took it back into store and went to customer service desk. I waited a few minutes in the queue to be pushed infront of by a member of staff on duty. I was told that I had to go up to the electrical desk and speak to them. The man on the electrical desk was only interested if I had purchased the extended warranty and gave me a leaflet  he had no idea what the process was for returning faulty goods and just told me to ring a number. I wasn t very pleased with the lack of information I had received so I went back to customer services to ask if there was anything that could be done in store. The lady working on the desk was apologetic and said that it was up to the people on the electrical desk and that there was nothing she could do. As far as I am aware electrical items have a 1 year warranty as standard and according to the consumer rights act 2015 the responsibility to repair or exchange faulty items is the stores not the manufacturer. It also states in your returns policy that if an item if found to be faulty within 12 months you guarantee a repair  exchange or full refund.  I love tesco usually but feel very let down today üò¢

Hi  I ordered some boots from you online yesterday and needed them as a matter of urgency.  I was delighted to discover that I had the option to pick a date for delivey and that today s date was available. I was happy to pay the ¬£5.95 for delivery.  I was advised my order had been received and would be delivered between 7am and 7pm today.  I was ready and waiting for delivery by 7am today.  No boots.  I checked my email and discovered an email from DPD advising they had not received the order from Tesco but would update me as soon as possible.  I waited.  No boots.  I checked on the DPD website via an emailed link which now tells me that my parcel was in Birmingham at 9.35pm and would be on its way to the Uddingston depot shortly. It also said at the bottom that my boots will not be delivered until Monday the 19th December.  I have paid ¬£5.95 to pick a date for delivery for Tesco to pick their own date.  I have hospital appointments on Monday and have no intention of missing my appointments in order to allow Tesco to deliver my item on a date I didn t pick.  I am extremely unhappy.  If you can t deliver until Monday you should state that at the time and allow me to make the informed decision t take my custom to someone who can.

Tesco. Is this in all your extra stores????  Just wanted to let all my friends know about the Christmas tree in the door way of Tesco with all the children s names and ages on. These are all the children in the area who do not receive a present on Christmas morning. You take a tag from the tree and buy them a gift to open at Christmas. I don t have much money but Olivia Yates Harrison Yates and I have each bought a few gifts for 3 children to open on Christmas morning. I m not posting this for a  well done   I am making people aware. (I only found out about this last week!!!) imagine if every shopper took a tag from the tree and there were none remaining?!!! How fabulous to think every child in the area was able to open a present??? Please share and make everyone aware. What s a couple of extra pounds on top of your Christmas shopping bill??? It s the difference that will bring happiness and smiles to the child you bought for. Do these children think they don t get a present because they have been naughty all year?? Please take a tag next time you shop and please share this post. xxxxx üéÅ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏èüéÑüéÖ

I d really am unhappy about the treatment my daughter and I received  this evening at your Northampton South Tesco store. All the aisles were packed with cages from one end to the other. Some aisles I couldn t even manoeuvre down or reach to the shelves due to the volume of cages. I accept that during the quiet evening period this is a good time to replenish shelves but please remember your store is still open and there are customers still shopping. Anyway  one particular aisle I went down a female member of staff started to pull a cage backwards so I move back and stand and wait for her to pass by us  but instead of moving the cage that was in her way she bashed the cage into my trolley! I shout out  woah   yet she continues pushing it after looking at me  and pushes the trolley handle into my 6 year old daughters neck and chest crushing her between the end of the aisle and my trolley. I had to ram the trolley forward to move the cage away and when I complain to this member of staff she just walks off! üò° After turning down into another aisle I could hear her telling another member of staff that I  was complaining?! I have every reason to complain about her behaviour as she had just injured my daughter and proceeded to be rude about it. I found her behaviour completely unacceptable and I expect better from staff especially while the store is still open to customers like myself.

I was in the Shoreham Holmbush Store today and was utterly insulted and highly offended that the store manager has decided to move the Free From food section to the middle of the toiletries and gym and slimming aids. As coeliacs we do not choose to eat gluten free as a  life style choice  as a member of staff referred to the reason it was moved. It shows a lack of common knowledge and insight by the manager to allow this change to happen. As a coeliac  I do not care if you need gondola space for the Christmas tat and promotions. I do not wish myself or other coeliacs be made feel marginalised and segregated further. I made a verbal complaint to two lads picking in the same isle and the said they were surprised themselves. The customer service desk lady also said I wasn t the first to complain and that she found it shocking and embarrassing that we would have to find our food in the pharmacy and toiletries section. I ve informed Coeliac UK both local branch and national HQ.

I want to say thank you to the staff at Riverside Bournemouth. My son fell over and hurt his lip in your store. As soon as he saw the blood he was hysterical. A member of staff was with me in seconds to ask what she could do to help  (sorry didn t get her name) while the promtional Lindor lady was already off getting me tissue.  When I asked for a cold compress  a first aider was called and I didn t get one  I got 5 within 10 seconds. One was getting ice for my son  while one was stopping the bleeding  one went off to get his favourite sweets and the other two asked if there was anything they could do to help. Tonita (who was awesome) stayed with us the whole time and the Lindor lady entertained my other two whilst I was consoling my little boy. A manager was also there and asked if she could do anything.  I honestly and still am shocked at how caring they all were. My other two boys ended up walking away with a Lindor bunny rabbit and the injured party got not one pack of sweets but 11. I was so emotional holding back the tears and then got told how much of an amazing person I was and to keep up the good work.   I want to say thank you from the bottom of my heart  you were all so professional  calm and simply amazing.

Very poor customer service in your Salford Store today!  Now I completely understand the stress of working retail  especially during the holiday season - I worked last year during the Christmas season on checkouts so I understand how busy and stressful it gets.   When I had gotten to the checkout with a few items  one of which had a security tag  so I thought it would be quicker to go to a person rather than self scan! The checkout operator I had was elderly  not sure her name. She was absolutely awful with customer s items  throwing it down the belt and not even waiting for them to pay and move before throwing the next customers items down the belt! She d thrown the lady s items so hard in front of me her box of doughnuts  burst open onto the floor. Ignoring my items for a bit I bent down to help her  noticing my own items was still being thrown down the belt with force. The operator then eventually stopped and stood up to scoop up the doughnuts and then started shouting at the lady to get another box herself while demanding me for my Tesco s card! The poor lady in front of me had to abandon her shopping and go and get another box of doughnuts at this point. I paid for my own shopping and turned to tell this operator to have a nice Christmas - and she started complaining to a customer behind me about myself and the lady in front of me! Something about  we don t need slow people at this time of year; people like that slow the whole checkout down!   This is absolutely unacceptable having being in customer service myself! I also suffer with multiple anxiety disorders so shopping in general  especially at this time of year  and going to an operator is a big deal for me  it s not right for your operators to be throwing items down and complaining to people about other customers! This resulted in myself having an anxiety attack. I know it s busy and stressful at this time of year but it s no excuse to treating customers in this manner.

Just wanted  to say a big well done to tesco Newmarket  my boys aged 2 and 1 actually  enjoyed shopping today :) they saw santa and lots of dressed up cheerful staff and tryed mini sausages apple and crisps :) also they decorated gingerbread  men :) makes a change from there normal mad screaming  lol also staff where very helpful  when I couldn t  find a live like mouse toy that was a must have Christmas  present  :)

Been let down by tesco yet again! It s 12:34 and your Alfreton branch have no gluten free cobs and no sandwich thins of any variety to buy! Well thanks very much for ruining my family s Christmas. They always shop with you and spend thousands in a year.  They are in the middle of selling their house and did not expect to move out before xmas so they ordered their xmas food with you to be delivered. However they have exchanged and contracts have been signed to move on 21st December.  Stressful enough moving let alone on top of xmas and now YOU have made it even worse. I am so  so unhappy. Last Thursday I ordered a next day delivery for a friend who lives 4 hours away as a birthday gift (I know it sounds lame but we are both students and the best gift we can get is food sometimes!). I paid ¬£3 for a delivery slot as well as ¬£4 basket charge on top of the actual shopping so that s ¬£7 just for delivery!  My friend stayed in for the allocated couple of hours on her birthday and waited but nobody came. I had a missed call from an unknown number who I called and text and received a message back saying it was the driver and he had knocked on the door but there had been no answer.  Now  my friend lives in a block of flats so you have to go through a door (which is always unlocked) to knock on her door and knowing she was in waiting felt maybe this was the problem. Rang customer services who contacted him and gave him her mobile number then rang me back to say he was still doing deliveries so would try again on his way back. My friend then had a call to say sorry  but he had  cocked the order up  (very professional) and would have to be tomorrow.  My friend had waited in for 4 hours on her birthday at this point. She then called three times over the course of the next two days  each time being told they would call her back and never did. Due to being a nursing student on placement I only managed to get hold of her this Tuesday - 3 days later! - for her to tell me that it had never come and nobody would return her calls. Just before 9pm Tuesday night I rang customer services again very upset that this had still not been delivered and neither of us knew what was happening.. the guy was very nice and understood my frustration and said he would call me back. Which he did.. to tell me that unfortunately  because it was coming to the end of the night  they had already closed down all the tracking systems- 2 hours before customer services close! So could I please call back tomorrow. I couldn t call back tomorrow as I was at the hospital all day and today have discovered that I received an email saying Tesco are  pleased to confirm my refund  days ago!  So in short : my delivery was not delivered on the day it should have been. No effort was made to try and redeliver and in fact efforts made by the customer were ignored  customer service apparently shut down their systems two hours before the end of their shift  and not only does my friend not have her birthday present even a week after(!!) But my order has been cancelled and refunded without me even being consulted!  I m not sure if there is any other way your customer service could have failed in this situation and I am thoroughly appalled and frankly  quite upset! I now have to order her something else for her birthday and a little something extra to make up for missing it!

My Hero! .....A huge thanks to the manager from the Tesco online depot that services the Kingussie village area in the Highlands of Scotland. I m 45 miles from the nearest large Tesco (15 from a small one) - I m disabled  live on my own (but look after my mum who lives near me and is blind) and currently having chemo so can t get to either store. I ordered the Xmas stuffed turkey crown (easy to cook when I m feeling so poorly) from online and checked it was in stock the night b4 my planned Xmas freezer food delivery but it never came :( I told the driver my predicament - he rang the manager who promised to get one to me before Christmas. A day later there was a ring at the door and there was my turkey - compliments of the manager. So thanks him for making my Christmas Day complete and his amazing kindness to me at a time when life has given me a downer (I ve lost my job while off work ill as well). Three cheers for my Christmas hero ... Alison

Hi   My 3year old son and I visited your local Tesco Express on Stanton Road  Burton (DE15) this evening.  As a 3 year old it can be tough having to go shopping with your Mummy after a long day at nursery but my son was trying his best to be well behaved and find everything we needed  he even helped carry the basket and gave the broccoli a stroke. We were helped by a lovely lady (I m sorry  I didn t find out her name but she had a lovely smile  went out of her way to be helpful and had a few piercings if that helps identify her).  She helped us find everything we needed  even though Mummy was a bit frantic by the amount of times we d discussed which cakes Nannar had bought him last time she visited and helped him decide which magazine was required (it can be difficult to choose a favourite reading between Peppa Pig and Go Jetters  Mummy frankly thinks you offer too many choices!)  The very kind lady told my son where she d hidden the squash and special offers on pizza before she waved us both goodbye and wished George (my son) a Merry Christmas on the way out. As I mentioned before Mummy was having a hectic moment when we visited your store  it had been a busy day at work  a long journey back to nursery to pick her little man and lots of idiot drivers on the way there which she had been unable to express her utter contempt for as she had her lovely son in her car and her feelings towards said drivers were not appropriate to be shared with a 3 year old. As a result we didn t manage to express to the kind lady just how much easier and enjoyable she d made our visit Tesco so I m hoping that you would be able to do that and pass our thanks and best wishes for the Christmas season to her. We both hope she has a lovely Christmas and New Year and thank you for being so lovely when we visited today.

I was quite upset today whilst visiting the new big tescos in Bicester! I complained about the lady in Question to her supervisor who took her off the till to have a word with her and assured me other members of staff would be told too!! I actually lifted up my top and showed the supervisor lady my ileostomy bag and explained it s hard to go out some days and when I get a sarky comment like that for using a toilet I m actually entitled to use it makes me want to stay home!!! Generally like Tesco s products  but this week has been disastrous.  On Tuesday at Wolverton  Milton Keynes  we bought a week s supplies.  This included two new to us products - Chinese Meal for Two and Beef Casserole.  The Chinese comprised prawn crackers  spring rolls  egg fried rice  sweet and sour chicken and chicken with cashew nuts.  The spring rolls were almost entirely pastry with minimal filling.  The sweet and sour chicken was too sweet  even for sweet and sour  with too little fruit or veg and too much sauce   The chicken with cashews was nearly as sweet as the sweet and sour  which it should never be  mostly sauce and the cashew nuts were very scarce.  The chicken  which the label admitted was from Thailand  lacked texture and flavour and could easily have been mistaken for tofu!  The beef casserole was worse.  The gravy was unpleasantly glutinous and was by far the main ingredient.  The vegetables were lacking in quantity.  But worst of all  half of the beef was inedible due to gristle and sinew.  Much of it went in the food waste bin!

Lovely to visit your Dalkeith hyperstore today and find what music there was was limited to a small area and very quietly at that. Unfortunately my main branch is at Berwick on Tweed. Most of the year this is a peaceful and unstressful place but it has now descended into the madness of last year - but worse. Not only is the bakery section unapproachable because of raucous music but there are tinny yet loud CD players at other points in the shop. ( A mole tells me there are 4 of them) Many people are unable to use the basket till by the entrance because of the raucous noise.It is unwelcoming to be greeted at the door by a barrage of sound. One lady was so distressed the other day that she strode over and turned the wretched thing off. Within a few yards of this  at the Christmas card section  there is another CD player blaring out stressful inanity. Remember the cacophony of separate devices all playing different things. This is the 21st century - isn t it about time Tesco had a comprehensive disability policy and also trained its staff in disability awareness? Some of the new staff seem to have few interpersonal skills. Christmas is unpleasant and stressful for many people. There is no need to add to it inthe hope that you will shore up your falling profits by bludgeoning people into buying by numbing their brains with excess noise. Please send this to the appropriate management section at head office.

This is not a complaint; this is a suggestion borne of extreme frustration. Yesterday evening I visited one of your stores with my one year old son. I work full time and therefore have to shop during peak hours (weekends and evenings). I often shop with him by myself which makes it a bit tricky if spaces near the trolley bays are full.  I would never complain about a lack of parent and child spaces as  when used correctly  there are more than enough. However  last night  I watched a man cut in front of me and take the last remaining parent and child space. I also watched as his (roughly) NINE year old son got out the vehicle and the two of them walked into the store. The rest of the car park was full so I parked at the back  no where near trolleys or the store. I carried my son to the store to put him in a trolley  and when we were done  had to carry him and the bags back to my car. I then had the issue of squeezing him in as someone was parked next to me by this point.  I was exhausted last night and I had just had enough of this. I wrote to your customer services team  however  they called this an  unavoidable problem . I see this so much with parents who park here and one will go in whilst the other stays in the car with the infants (why?!) and parents of much older children who can walk themselves into the store. To me  having these spaces here and not putting a penalty for misuse is just insulting. This issue is not unavoidable and will be affecting thousands of busy and exhausted infant parents every day.  There are penalties for parking in other allocated spaces. Your sign clearly states that the spaces are for use of parents with children under three. Include on that sign that there will be a penalty for misuse. The threat alone would stop so much of this from happening and your parent and child spaces would make shopping that little bit less stressful (which I imagine is the point?). As I said  this is a suggestion as I am not buying your excuse that this problem is  unavoidable .

BEING FORCED TO WORK A SUNDAY? An employer has the right  whether or not it is explicitly reflected in the employment contract  to require a worker to work on a public holiday. It is common in industries such as retail or emergency services. We have also heard from hon. Members about other sectors such as hospitality  sport and leisure. Employers can determine when workers take their leave‚Äîfor example  to cover an annual shutdown at work‚Äîand can refuse to give leave at a certain time  but they must give workers the opportunity to take their leave at some point during the leave year. The entitlement should give all workers sufficient time to see their families over the year  although I accept that Christmas and various other times of the year are absolutely associated with spending time with family.  In addition  there are special provisions for shop workers who do not wish to work on Sundays  at least. All shop and betting shop workers can opt out of Sunday working  unless Sunday is the only day they have been employed to work. A shop worker can opt out of Sunday working  even if they agreed in their contract to work on Sundays  by giving three months‚Äô notice.

I also found  after placing the order  that the sets are supplied by a third party who IN TURN contract a fourth party to deliver them. You may be paying Tesco - but that s not where your goods are coming from. I have cancelled the whole order in frustration. You d think over ¬£700 worth of business would be more important to a company who are languishing in the retail sector....

On 21/11/2016 i was driving to pick my husband up from work in Binley Coventry  when one of your tesco.com vans cut the motorway lane without indicating and took me off the road..... If i hadn t drove on to the verge your van would had gone straight into the side of my car at at least 40mph. The side my toddler sits. I had 3 very scared children after what happened. I rang customer serves  who told me they would look into what happened and get back to me. That night i had a phone call from a manager at one of your Coventry stores who was shocked at what happened and promised to call me back....... Well 3 weeks on and I ve still not heard a thing... The night it happened i could hardly drive the rest of the way to get my husband i was so scared and shocked that your van could do that and then beep at me like it was my fault... I had no idea they were changing lanes we had just drove a corner and they didn t indicate to show they were changing lanes.. I really don t get why no one has got back to me about this. Dose your company not care about the way your drivers drive?? or the fact they took me off the road and if i didn t drive on to the verge you could of done so much damaged to my car and my 3 children that were in there.  Please will someone finally get back to me to let me know what has happened about this!!!!

Dear Nessa and Family    I can see from the adverts that you re a busy family lately  with that cheeky son  pineapple fearing hubby and a turkey dinner to cook for the  five thousand (or 10 but who s really counting).  With your busy lifestyle I m sure you ll appreciate the little bits of luxury that you get to treat yourself to every now and then. You work hard  your run a family and a home whilst holding down a job (and travelling between Barry Island and Honiton) and sometimes it s nice to give yourself a little something extra.   As you re no doubt aware it s coming up to Christmas time and that means present buying and with that comes present wrapping. Some people love it. They absolutely love it. They ve got the protractors out measuring right angles  scalpels at the ready and could take on the world. Now  I have  a friend  who recently popped in to your local Honiton Tesco store in Devon to purchase the necessary tools including the wrapping paper. We all know that this fancy outer layer to your present can really set the tone. It s like getting a Kinder Egg  you just know it s going to be good. My  friend  decided that day would be treat day. Caution was thrown to the wind. That day luxury wrapping paper was purchased. I ll wait whilst you take a second to get your breath back. Better? Good.   A roll of your 3M Luxury Wrapping Paper was taken home. My god and Sweet baby Jesus those presents were going to look good! As you know   Every little help makes a big difference . This luxury paper was going to seal the deal. Move over Pamela these presents are going to be hot. My  friend  was armed and ready  equipment laid out ready to do this. This is where this real life true story hits a snag. Paper was cut   present sat happily in the middle  tape at the ready. And then. Mr Tape was applied to said Luxury Wrapping Paper. Did it stick? No. Ok  well we all know that some tapes are not as good as others  but it s ok. There was a leading brand in the drawer  unopened all innocent in its packet like our sweet baby Jesus on his birthday. Take two. Paper was cut   present sat happily in the middle  tape at the ready. And then  Mr Tape was applied to said Luxury Wrapping Paper. Did it stick? No. My  friend  kept trying. Time and time again Mr Luxury Wrapping Paper would not accept this sacred bond. At this point there s glitter all over the place like a fairy has ate too many sprouts and has glitter farted spraying it everywhere! Over the floor  over my  friend   glitter in their hair looking like they re off on a night on the town. A Christmas sparkly town.  You can imagine the distress  that one treat  that every little that could help those presents just set the tone. To say dreams were shattered is an understatement. Now my friend has naked presents  and worse  naked Luxury Wrapping Paper that looks like a man on his stag do who fell asleep and the lads shaved his glittery hair off  bald as the sweet baby Jesus on the day he was born.  Please tell me you can help my  friend  and restore their faith in the joy of Christmas  the joy of wrapping presents and the joy of Luxury Wrapping Paper.   We eagerly await your response to our Christmas nightmare.  Many thanks Pete and my  friend  who really is real Lisa Gummer.

What amazing staff you have at Tesco Victoria Viaduct  Carlisle.  I had purchased a 43 inch Smart TV in the Black Friday deals in November  and since it had been turning itself off and on. I had called up the Tesco electronics helpline where I was told to take the TV back in store where it could be either exchanged or be collected for repair (even though I told said person on the phone I had no transport). I decided to take my 43 inch television on the bus with me  even though it was bulky and weighed a little.  When I made it to the service desk  they had no clue what to do. They had never heard of bringing it back into store and the courier collecting it from there. I told them I had no transport so getting it home was a task. So Mary  one of the ladies behind the desk  rang the electronics help line again where they explained my situation. Then Will  a manager had taken over the phone call and had explained they had no same TV in store and no way of getting it repaired. Will then came off the phone and offered me a refund. I explained I liked the TV and would much rather a repair. He understood.  Then Charlotte  another colleague  decided to call the manufacturer. Within a few minutes she was arranging my TV to be collected for repair just needing me to give my details over. Needing the serial number off the back of the TV she took a photo on her phone for me to read to the person still on the phone. Then everything was done. My TV was going to be repaired.  I thanked them all and was going to be on my way when Racheal  another lady behind the counter offered me a lift home with my TV and to my surprise Charlotte and Sam handed me over a ¬£10 good will gift voucher.  But if anyone was doing the good will it was them.  What a good team of staff you have. Each and every one I met  went above and beyond for me. And I appreciate every bit of it.   Thank you Tescos  Every little did help.

I really do think your packers need some guidance in substitutions! Today s useful subs:  I ordered three products from your Finest (I.e. more expensive) party foods range on 3 for 2. Two items arrive (both vegetarian). The third option was not available (season and shake waffle fries - also vegetarian) and gets substituted with cheap (not finest) chicken goujons (clearly not vegetarian  not even decent quality free range meat). I confused the driver trying to work out how this affected the 3 for 2 and just accepted them figuring they were free and I could find someone who might appreciate them. Looking at my receipt more carefully now  I didn t get the the bloody 3 for 2 anyway and have ended up paying for an item I don t want and can t eat. Why would someone substitute chips for chicken?   Then we get the GF cheese and onion crisp bakes substituted with cheese and ham hock ones.  Surely it would be common sense for packers not to substitute meat free products with meat?!   Not particularly happy with Tesco right now especially after someone from Tesco rang a few weeks back doing a survey asking how happy I was with my deliveries  the drivers  substitutions etc and I mentioned then that the thing that irritated me the most was meat free products being substituted with meat products. I know us vegetarians are frowned upon and get very few decent veggie options but you sending me meat products isn t going to sway me back to eating meat!

Mr Adam Monday  member of staff calling for the first aider and showing great concern so hats off to this young man. My wife was helped to her feet by myself then felt sick and dizzy with pain to her right arm and shoulder and to leave the premises immediately for fresh air leaving me to pay for the unfinished shopping  hence no formal report was filed in writing which I might add will be rectified this week.  As a result we both had very little sleep that night and spent most of Sunday in Carlisle A&E. Thankfully there are no broken bones but apparently ruptured ligaments can take longer to heal oh happy days NOT.  With the run up to Christmas and loads to do looking likely I m going to have to leave work a week earlier now to help at home as she can only use her left hand properly.  The reason I m letting you know about this episode is as follows  my wife doesn t like any fuss nor does she like the idea of anyone getting into trouble and above all puts a brave face on  she is sitting here in tears because of the pain and stressing about sorting things out for the family for Christmas.  I m not like my wife  I m absolutely furious. John Morrison.

As this is my local store I will now be shopping elsewhere in the hopes I get a decent level of service.
