I would like to publicly thank the staff at Tesco Hythe (Hampshire)  Going back a couple of months ago now  I was shopping with my 2 year old & my 2 week old. It was pretty stressful as 2 week old decided as soon as we walked into the shop that he was hungry & 2 year old was being just that - a 2 year old!  The option for him to have a free apple to eat helped enormously as we started our shop. However as he finished his apple he began to get upset again (not wanting to be sat in the trolley!) we continued until we got to the checkout at which point both 2 week old & 2 year old were pretty hysterical & people were staring! Part of me just wanted to leave my trolley full of shopping & walk out but my stubborn side made me continue! Whilst unpacking the shopping  2 members of staff (management I believe) came over & started to talk to my 2 year old. They asked him what was wrong & he pointed to the  Bob the builder  toy at the end of the isle that he had seen & really wanted. Without a second thought  the staff took this out of its box & handed it to him. My initial thought was of dread - that I now needed to pay for this üò¨ however they would not let me pay for it & continued to talk to my little boy & to play with him whilst I packed up my shopping (jiggling & shhhhhhing the 2 week old in his sling) - they did offer to help with the packing too!  These 2 members of staff turned a very stressful shopping trip into a successful one & I have been wanting to public thank them for their thoughtfulness since the event  but have been a little busy!  I hope that this message gets back to them  it was a man & a woman  I m sure they would remember us  my 2 year old was pretty loud üò¨ Your generosity meant that once back in the car  my 2 year old happily played with his toy whilst I was able to feed my 2 week old. Thank you  I am so very grateful!  Have a fabulous Christmas üòò

Sadie s efforts towards local fundraising have seen her participate in some amazing events for charity in store and she is always prepared to do what it takes to get the message across to your shoppers. She is always smiling  even when she is dressed in the most outrageous of costumes and you can see how dedicated she is to helping make an impact on the lives of those less fortunate. I just wanted to give her a mention as this time of year is about giving  so Sadie  I see all that you re doing out there and I hope your company does too. Have a merry Christmas and may that festive magic bring you as much happiness as you re bringing to others. #everylittlehelps

I am writing to inform you of my experience today. I was at your store in Gaywood  Kings Lynn  clothe shopping with my 12 year old daughter. As she is short for her age I needed her to try on her clothes. The changing room was locked. There was a button which said to press for assistance. I did so. Waited five minutes and pressed again. Still nothing. I walked to a lady standing in front of the till (she had a telephone headset on)  assuming she could help. I told her I d pressed the button twice and still nothing. She then told me the button didn t work. Why no signs? Anyway  she said she d get someone for me. I heard the loud speaker asking for someone to attend the changing room. I waited another ten minutes  still nothing. I asked her again  she put out another call. Waited another ten minutes. Still nothing. Decided to give up. As I walked past her  I told her to forget the call  as I had had enough waiting. Her response of  sorry lovey . Sorry lovey???? No further attempt to help or resolve the problem. I ended up driving to Asda where the staff were more than happy to assist! Very poor show!

Contacted you via Twitter with my complaint which according to you has now been dealt with by issuing me an apology.   Twice you have sent me my monthly savings vouchers after the start date and when I have already done my weekly shop  so I have missed out.   Last month you issued me with a money card to compensate but this time you are telling me that it was a one of goodwill gesture and that this time after just spending ¬£80 in your store you will not honour the ¬£12 voucher that arrived too late to use with my shop. This is not ¬£1 or ¬£2 this is enough to by all months worth of nappies/wipes.  I am now being told I can t complain to anyone else as your twitter employees (probably the same as the people on here) are the end of the line. You have no managers or people higher than those who answer social media posts.   This is what spending ¬£80 week in week out with you gets. No loyalty.   I can see your sending all your lovely online customers nice hampers too. That s great.   Everyweek I shop in your store which is not a pleasant experience  the staff who go round collecting the Internet shopping are rude. Stand around chatting whilst blocking aisles. Your trolleys are dangerous and have no brakes yet show pictures to tell you to enable brakes when you have children in the trolley.   The sole reason I continue to shop in your store is the fact you send out reward vouchers and have a great selection of dairy free products for my son.   However I see no point carrying on spending over a ¬£1000 year with a company who won t even honour vouchers that they send out late.  I ll leave this nice post here for everyone to read. Hopefully someone will respond with a complaints department  if not then at least all of the other customers you cheat out of loyalty vouchers might see it.

Absolutely disgusted after my trip to Tesco today to exchange a jumper I bought via click and collect! I bought 3 jumpers using my clubcard vouchers and when they arrived one was too small. Because the jumper was bought as part of an offer  I was only refunded 400 points  so now I have no jumper  no points that I can use and I feel completely unsatisfied by your service! Had I known of your new policy I wouldn t have bothered ordering at all! Very disappointed  as is my daughter who now doesn t have the Christmas jumper she wanted for Christmas jumper day at school!

To say I am fuming is an understatement!!  You released dates for click and collect for the Christmas period and I duly booked my slot in the Friday for 16:00 to 18:00 at my local store and thought job done. Hi Tesco   I have been left feeling really disappointment my your butchers in your Accrington store. I went in two weeks ago and asked if I could order a rib of people for 8 people  to be collected the day before Christmas Eve. A lady took all my details  double checked that they could offer this service and informed me I could collect it on my desired date. Today I went shopping  as I normally do with yourself ever Sunday  and double checked with your butchers that my order had been received. The lady informed me that I could not preorder meat and they had no record of my order. I am sure you can imagine how glad I am that I double checked and I didn t wait until the 23rd to collect it. I am sure you can imagine the panic that would have been caused. Please could you make sure that all your staff now that this service isn t offered  as I have now got to source meat from elsewhere  adding something back on to my very long Christmas to do list.

After visiting Tesco today for the second time this week I am really disappointed. Not only does the introduction of Christmas items cause  Free From  items to be moved all over the store and not under  Free From  signage but it also means that you have reduced your already limited range of dairy and soya free items in store.   Having a toddler with a dairy (and possibly soya) allergy is hard enough but when stores stop stocking products it makes it almost impossible. Tesco are by far the most superior supermarket when it comes to  Free From  products but at the moment you are on a par with  if not worse than the other supermarkets. The  Free From  range this week was pretty much non existent  you had no yoghurts  spread and very limited amounts of milk which were both dairy and soya free. To make matters worse a Tesco colleague tried to give me lactose free milk telling me it was the same as dairy free. I have no problem with staff members not knowing which products do or don t contain dairy or soya but when they clearly do not know about dietary needs then they certainly shouldn t be giving out false information and making it up.   There is definitely a gap in the market for dairy and soya free products in general but more specifically those which are targeted at children  it s as if only adults have these allergies. For example my two year old doesn t eat the same amount of yoghurt as an adult in one sitting and putting half a tub into a Tupperware and into the fridge for the next day doesn t work either as the yoghurt separates and goes all funny. And if you have a diary allergy you have to have a very plain palette as the only flavour you can have in anything is coconut. Surely it can t be hard to make a strawberry flavoured milk and soya free yoghurt?   If you could let me know when you plan to reintroduce these products back into store and if you intend to extend the range at any time I would appreciate that.   Thank you

Not one for big facebook posts but I am in absolute shock about the service I have received from Tesco.  I purchased a high value  Christmas present on 25th Nov - was due to be delivered within 3-5days  no sign. After emailing customer services apparently the delivery driver could not find the address/there was no one there to receive the item - there had been someone at the property on every single one of his  attempted  deliveries.  It was then advised that he had left a card at the address he was attempting to deliver at which was clearly incorrect  according to Tesco we needed to retrieve this card... how/why??? I provided a correct address  why is it my responsibility to figure out where the delivery driving is attempting to deliver to?!  Anyway we did  the property we believed they were attempting to deliver to was vacant so no way we could retrieve the card but a note was left saying call this no. if you are attempting to deliver said item for Tesco.  It was then advised by Tesco we would be contacted directly by the courier - this didn t happen.  After lots of back & fourth we were advised firstly that Tesco could not get a response from there courier - my options were... wait & see if it gets delivered before Christmas  or get a refund as the item was sold out & they couldn t guarantee it would be back in stock before Christmas.   Obviously I was not happy with this  found the item elsewhere at a much higher value & requested from Tesco they reimburse the difference - not possible  this is against company policy  obviously!  In the meantime I was advised by one of Tesco s customer service advisors on twitter that my item had infact been lost by Yodel  whilst on the same day a different customer service advisor advised me via email that they would attempt to redeliver next week...  if this is not the height of embarrassment for such a big  trusted brand as Tesco I don t know what is.  I really cannot believe the service I ve received!  & I still have to wait 3-5 days for my refund of ¬£400 to be processed - money which they have had for 15days without me receiving my item!  I m hoping by putting this post of facebook I will receive a more appropriate response than I have thus far!  üò°

Me and my fiance bought a tree from Tesco online on the 12th of November. expected delivery 3-5 working days! What a joke that turned out to be! Time passes well after 7 days calls tesco to be told we have to call a company sports hq! fine called them said it was delivered?! lies!! They read out our address house number 1/1 when my fiance tried to explain to the person on the call that there is no house number 1/1 that is our flat number and gave them the correct house number no one could understand what my fiance was going on about!! They put him on hold for god knows how long only to be hung up on! When he called back another person didnt understand what we were trying to explain! Its not that hard!! After about an hour and half on the phone we were told to call sports hq. Got a girl on the phone who said it was sent back to the warehouse but they have to wait till its signed as back before they can re send it to the correct address. Fine waited passed another week still nothing! Called sports hq back was advised it still hasn t been signed back and theres nothing they could do! At this point i asked for a refund I was then put on hold when the girl came back she said she could send one out just now and we would get it in 2 days! So how is this possible if it wasn t back in the warehouse yet??! We decided to go ahead with the refund was told 3-5 working days that had passed still nothing! We then got a text from Tesco this week asking to call them to give card details called them said they don t give the refund sports hq do? SERIOUSLY eventually after having to repeat the card number 5 TIMES then being passed to another department to also repeat the card number it was resolved expected 3-5 working days this isn t good enough Tesco I will never shop with you again if this is how you treat your customers unbelievable!!

Absolutely appalled at the service we received at one of your stores today by the duty manager!! My 11 year old son was with his nan with the intent to buy his younger brother a present for Xmas. Nan had gone to the toilet and my son and found a box of lego he liked to buy his brother and went to wait for his nan to return from the toilet at the front of the store with the box to show her what he had found. It was here he was approached and stopped by the duty manager who then accused my son of stealing!!! His reason for doing so was my son had passed all points for method of payment yet hadn t actually left the premises! How can an 11 year old child that is making no attempt to run no attempt to conceal or hide the product and no attempt to leave the premises be accused of theft? If the product hasn t left the store surely it can t be classed as stolen!! When my wife went to the store to complain she was told by the duty manager that he was  preventing an incident !!! No you ve had made a very bad judgement!! My son is devastated that he has been accused of being a thief and very upset by the whole incident. Tesco you really do need to educate your staff a little bit better with the law as if the police would have been called they would have simply agreed with us that the product hadn t left the store so no crime has been committed.  We will be contacting head office to make a complaint as well

So angry with you Tesco- you cancel my delivery today  not notifying me until half an hour after it was due- and offer a derisory ¬£10 as compensation. I m a Delivery Saver Customer mid week so have recently been using Click and Collect for Fri-Mon shopping if required. I do this because I have to order large amounts of Dairy Free milk for my daughter to tide us over and thus save me numerous trips to the Supermarket (where I inevitably spend more!) . I very clearly have added notes in the  notes  section to not offer Dairy  Soya or Coconut alternatives if my milk is unavailable  (leaving Almond  Hazlenut or Hemp). Imagine my annoyance today when my husband has gone to collect to find 6 of the milks replaced with Soya ones? He was given a refund but we need the milk not the refund. I visit tescos often for the free from range (which is amazing) however twice I ve been in my nearest tescos and picked up something and it s scanned through at a higher price than what the ticket or what it s advertised at! First time was some finding dory plastic mugs the ticket said ¬£2.50 however got to the till scanned through at ¬£5 each. So instead of honouring the ticket price (which is what is meant to happen) they just took them off my bill and put to one side. Second time I went in there was tinsel in a box with a massive ¬£1 sign on each side of said red box  I thought till I ll have some of that. Again got to the till scanned in at ¬£3 (I was not paying ¬£3) so again instead of honouring the price the staff member took it off my bill and removed all the tinsel out of that box. To say I m embarrassed is an understatement. For example of how it should be done  went into sainsburys and brought some yogurts the ticket said ¬£1.50 (sale price) came through the till at ¬£2 spoke to the cashier and the supervisor went and checked (like I would expect) came back and reduced the price to what the ticket said. Tesco s Scam   People with a Tesco credit card get a letter offering 0% interest on Tesco purchases between 1/11/16-31/12/16 when they use their card  which must be paid before 31/3/17.  What they don t say is if you have use your card at other outlets or even Tesco fuel/Opticians etc  you must pay the whole balance when you monthly statement arrives  including the Tesco Store purchase otherwise you will incur interest from the purchase date  regardless of the  Apparent Offer .  I m sure this won t be displayed long  so please share with your friends and family so they don t get caught out at Christmas. This could be a genuine mistake by senior management and I m sure they will rectify their misrepresentation.

Re: Tesco Travel Money Refund RF richard fleckney   Reply| Today  17:48 Tesco@travelex.com  Hello   Thank you for your e-mail.  You say I was unable to supply photographic I.D. and / or my payment card.  I have supplied both !!  On 3 separate occasions today.  The problem was  I was asked to put my card in the card reader and punch in the pin number( this doesn t work because the card is old and worn and it suits me because I never use it at ATM s etc.)  When I received confirmation of the transaction( see below ) it clearly states that I need to bring the card used in the transaction.................Nowhere does it mention pin numbers etc.  Collecting your order  The person whose credit/debit card was used to pay for the order must be the person who collects the order and they must bring the following:  Order confirmation number  A valid photo ID (UK Photographic Driving Licence  Passport or EU ID card)  The credit/debit card used to pay for this order Pick up date: Pick up point location: After 2pm on 09/12/2016 Ilkeston - Tesco - Extra  Rutland street  DE7 8DG  I have contacted my bank  HSBC who have confirmed that Tesco have had my money since yesterday.  As Tesco are unwilling to carry out the agreed transaction that I have already paid for and are unwilling to give me my money back now ( only after 10 days !!!) we are unable to afford to go on holiday now.  I have just rang our friends to explain that we will not be picking them up later as agreed ( to go on holiday ) so they will have to book a taxi or some alternative.  So ! because of Tesco we have lost our money  our holiday and some good friends.  HSBC are to contact their fraud squad as they can see that a transaction has been attempted during my third visit to Tescos today  Would you say Tesco are committing fraud ??  Or just downright criminal ??  Your thoughts ?  Richard Fleckney

Before I start my moaning  let me first say I love Tesco! I love the fact you deliver me food so I don t have to shop with 3 small children. I love club card points. And I used to love Tesco direct! I live in Orkney and on the 29th November  went on a road trip to the big smoke that is Inverness  so I visited Tesco  as you do  and saw a vacuum that was on offer  my mum has been needing a new vacuum so I thought it was perfect. As my car was already quite full I went to one of your fancy machines and ordered the vacuum to be delivered to Kirkwall store when I got home.  On 3rd December I got a text to say it arrived. I was delighted. So today I set off to Kirkwall to collect the vacuum only to be told once I got there that it wasn t in store. I advised that I got a text  showed them my text but no the text was wrong the vacuum was not there I would have to go back another day. When I got home I thought surely nearly a week after I got the text my order must have arrived so I phoned Tesco direct who checked with the store and low and behold it is there!!! Hello Tesco. Can you please advise the position regarding why Tesco Harford Norwich petrol station keeps closing in the evening. When is sweet potato mash not sweet potato mash answer - when half of it is ordinary potato whats going on   Bought sweet potato mash in new packaging ( I thought)  didn t seem like sweet poTati mash to us  I read the back of the packet and low and behoLd. HALF of the  sweet potato mash  is in fact normal potato so sweet potato mash isn t actually sweet potato mash. It s sweet potato and potato mash ? 45 % sweet potato 45% potato NOT sweet potTo mash as far as I am concerned is this against trade description rules  as it s advertised as one thing but is patently another Why do you keep putting cheaper ingredients in  if I buy sweet potato mash I expect it to be sweet mash wont be buying that again - incredibly dissappointed customer

That is the last time I will be shopping with Tesco in any form.  I usually buy my petrol  food and most toys etc through you  not any more.  The customer service is absolutely disgusting you are forced to wait hours arguing on the phone only for the things you have agreed to never happen and constantly being let down while they hold onto your money.    I order 2 bikes for the children  they loose not one but both of them  do they call you to tell you  no they wait till nearly a week later when you chase where they are to tell you.  One of the bikes is now out of stock and there are no  suitable  alternatives.  You eventually agree (after a lot of complaining) they will keep your money and email you when it is back in stock.  Do they no  when I checked on Friday it was in stock  I wait till Sunday for an email which doesn t come so I called only to find out it is out of stock again.  So I complain again  I am advised they will give me a ¬£10 good will gesture - I am not interested in money I want my bike which was heavily discounted due to the pre Black Friday sales  if I simply got a refund I am NOW not going to get anywhere as cheap.  He asks what he can do I advise you can get me a suitable alternative at which point he tries to push several boys bikes as a replacement for the GIRLS bike I have purchased.  The only alternative is ¬£50 more which he can t match so I advise if you can t get me a bike then get someone who can.  He agrees as every manager is far too busy to speak to a customer that has already had to complain twice they will call me back.  Nearly 5 hours later I get a call back by which point I am more than a little angry. After much discussion she agrees to match the more expensive bike due to the extremely poor service but as it is sold by a partner I have to pay initially and then get a refund which I agree to  this should be processed in three days.  By Wednesday I have received no refund so I call back to explain I have an email agreeing to refund the price match but no refund for the original bike which I have now paid twice for.  I explain this 6 times to an operator who clearly is not listening to me and sounds like he had just woken up before being put on hold three times to  check this  he eventually agrees to return the original cost of the bike.  I ask for confirmation that the ¬£50 has already been processed at which point he gets completely confused with what I am talking  about  here is where I admit I completely loose it - I have spent half an hour on the phone explaining and repeating a story which should be clear from the notes what has happened and agreed  and he hasn t listened to a word.  He then puts me on hold again to come back and tell me they don t price match so they would never have agreed to do this.  I am clearly banging my head against a brick wall with this one so ask for another manager at which point he asks  can I ask why  REALLY.  Once again they are all to busy to speak to me but I make it quite clear there is no way I am getting off the phone with out speaking to some one they eventually come on the phone to tell me they need to wait to speak to the person who it was agreed with - sorry it is not my problem that your staff are incapable of making notes to explain what has happened and I am not waiting another day for this to be sorted.  It finally appears to have been but only after me chasing  pushing and complaining wasting my time and effort on something so simple.  I am now out of pocket more money than what both bikes cost me in the first place and have to wait another 3-5 days to get my money back.  What a joke  this is not the first time you have disappointed on orders last year I was told 2 days before my daughters birthday you had lost one of her presents and it was out of stock.  I am a firm believer of giving someone another chance but this time has just shown you don t care at all about your customers.  I am sure you won t miss one very loyal customer  but I will tell everyone about my disgusting experience with you.

Hi Tesco! How are you? Well  I hope. Since you re asking  I m just about DEMENTED - with YOU! Let me explain.   For at least the past 5 years I have religiously shopped in my local Tesco store. Let s say I spend  on average  ¬£120 a week  that s a total of ¬£41 650...(OMG  I had no idea it would be that much..)  Being such a loyal customer  I make use of your clubcard scheme. I have been saving my vouchers up all year  eagerly anticipating spending them on Christmas. So  suitably prepared  I did some online shopping to help Santa out. Everything went well  I placed my order  shut the lid on the laptop  poured a nice glass of wine (purchased from Tesco) and sat back to relax knowing that Christmas was all wrapped up....Well  almost.  I received an email a couple of days later explaining that You were very sorry  but part of the order I placed and You accepted could not be delivered  I m assuming due to stock issues. Not to worry  I thought  I ll get that one other item elsewhere and You can refund my vouchers.  A couple of days later  I open the faithful laptop to order yet another item from Tesco  at the checkout  I was dismayed to find that I couldn t pay with my remaining Clubcard Vouchers  because You hadn t replaced them. I phoned your helpline and spoke with a very helpful lady who explained that the points would be added onto my statement in February....February!!?? That s no good  I need them now  I ve spent ¬£41 650 in your store and funds are running a wee bitty low. The lady on the phone was very helpful  she said she would send me a Money Card number along with a pin and I could purchase my wares online again.  So  myself and the trusty laptop begun our mission to order a lovely Tesco Christmas dinner. We loaded the cart  picked a delivery slot  added the carrier bags....Guess what happened when we got to the checkout? That s right..! We couldn t pay with the gift/money card.  Now  call me old fashioned  but since Tesco made the error in the original online purchase  surely  considering my previous loyal payments of ¬£41 650 (I still can t believe that number...)  you should be helping me out.....please..  So Tesco  I m going to sit down now with another lovely glass of your relaxing wine and wait for you to get back to me on how best we can sort this out - time is running short to make sure I have all the Extra Special ingredients to WOW my family and friends on the big day.   Remember Tesco  Every Little Helps...Ho  Ho  Ho  Merry Christmas...!

I ve always been a loyal customer and I m sorry for this complaint  but I guess this needs to be pointed out.  Your soy milk was 75p  at least during this entire year. I just wanted to say how impressed I was with the Tesco easy entertaining service. We used it for  the first time for a family birthday celebration. Ordering on line was very straight forward and it was delivered to a weekend holiday house in a very rural location 10 minutes earlier than the delivery slot. The driver was friendly and very helpful. The food was excellent. All with instructions for heating and meats and salads nicely packed and presented.  It certainly made life easy and we were able to choose something for everyone of the ten of us  including teens and toddlers. Would not hesitate to recommend it and use it again. Thanks Tesco  not always my favourite shop  but praise when it is due.

So I just went to the Tesco Express on Pilgrims Way in East Ham. They close at midnight and I got there at 11:40. Right Tesco!  From a loyal customer who shops with you on a regular basis and who has always recommend you as the best place to do online groceries  I have to say I am appalled with you today!! So you emailed which I only saw as you stated about it... so now I have waiting around all evening for you to deliver groceries which are needed to make a packed lunch for my daughters trip... and what do I have.. nothing! NO you did not call and I d probably say this was a mistake from your end  and I have been fobbed off with an excuse. What on earth have you done to your banana milkshake mix!!??!!  I  have always been a huge huge consumer of this ( I go through around 4-6 pints a day) and always favoured this over Nesquik which I found to be a bit overly sweet.  There is something odd about the way it behaves now when first spooned in to the milk  then when stirred it feels like the milk is thick and gloopy but it isnt but all this pales in to insignificance compared to whatever it is you have done to the taste!  Your mix used to taste creamy with just the right non over powering genuine flavour of banana  but now it tastes a bit gritty and the banana flavouring is now just horribly synthetic and leaves a nasty after taste.  Why did you fiddle about with it?  If its not broke dont fix it!  I am afraid I will now be going back to Nesquik as  as much as I have tried  I just do not like your  new improved  version. Can anyone at Tesco how they can justify the following please.  I and my wife actually like a certain Ros e wine purple label a Tesco Spanish wine..........i also recommended this wine to friends i know and our local Tesco keeps running out of it.  This wine was really well priced at only ¬£3.00 per bottle and at 11% was a very nice wine and as i say being very well priced  So.........why did they reduce the strength by half% and slightly change the label..............OK we could live with that but then about a month or so ago the price went up by 15 pence a 5% increase and not satisfied with this increase they thought lets put it up another 35 pence another 12%...............do you think customers are stupid?. I have shopped in Tesco as long as i can remember but i am not going to be made a fool of........recently i have been shopping in Bargain Stores..........like Home Bargains and B and M and the price difference on some of the items is astounding..take just a couple of items........Kellogg s variety pack...Home Bargains and B and M......normal price ¬£1....Tesco normal price ¬£2 but on special this week at 50% off ...¬£1....conning the customer thinking they have a massive bargain. Pot Noodle  ¬£1 in Tesco....Home Bargains and B and M normal price just 69 pence....Maris Piper potatoes worked out at exactly twice the price by weight at Tesco as they do at Home Bargains. Cheese...hams....all cheaper...I could go into Home bargains and buy just one pack of Kellogg s variety and go into Tesco and would have to buy ¬£100 worth of shopping to save the same amount of money..... ¬£1 and i would have to wait for that in the form of a voucher to present at my next Tesco shop and....if i was to buy a Kellogg s variety pack at the normal price of ¬£2....have i saved?......i don t think so!!

Dear Tesco    When selling yoghurts maybe you should make sure you products are clearly marked with dates.   As I clicked and collected on Sunday (4th) to find today that the  free from  CHILDRENS YOGHURTS you had given me went out of date on Friday (2nd) the packaging on the outside doesn t have the date on and only one yoghurt on the inside has the date which is hard to see as it is black writing in a dark purple lid.   I fed these to my 6 month old lactose free baby without even checking the date as I wasn t expecting to be delivered out of date food. I am disgusted and feel sick that my tiny newly weaned baby has been fed out of date food.   My child already suffers with stomach problems and this could have made him so much worse!   I suggest you check the shelves in your Shoreham store as the yogurts will need to be removed from the cardboard packaging to see if they are out of date. This isn t the first time I have been in the store and seen out of date food on the shelf 2 weeks ago your fruit pots were all out of date!   Train your staff before people start getting sick!

I wanted to talk a little bit about my experience of Tesco s mantra every little helps. Yesterday (Monday 5th December) I needed to get some fuel. 99%  of the time I go to Morrison for my fuel except on the rare occasion I run too low and attend the first fuel station available. Yesterday appeared to be that day and even with a vallaint effort to get to Morrison I found myself having to stop sooner at Tesco s  it wasn t a big issue or so I thought! It was busy  all the pumps were full and small queue s at each pump  in for a penny in for a pound join a queue any queue watching all the other vehicles around me I joined a queue. I got to the pump and there was a red sticker saying something about remote assistance for disabled drivers  there was no information on how to use or access the service and couldn t find any speakers or buttons and the queue is building up behind me so I positioned my car far enough out to have the additional space to get my chair out. Got out the car  used the car for balance and got the chair out the rear or the car  got seated and positioned  pick up the nosle and put it into my car. The screen says pay at the pump only. So I had to put the nosle back put my chair back into the car get myself back into the car  by this point the car in front is moving off  brilliant that will do nicely  pulled forward ready to get back out looked at the screen  pay at the pump only. I then had to drive all the out of the petrol station round the roundabout and back in rejoining the evergrowing queue which now also involved a police car 6 civilian cars and a hgv that couldn t decide where to go. Eventually after 5 mins I got myself into another queue at another pump. Here we go again.  pulled up with still no instructions on how to access disabled help  I got out the car leaving enough space to get my chair out  struggled to the rear of the car got my chair out and started to fill up. Once done I entered the shop to pay by cash. I was the only one in the shop as the last customer left as I was approaching. failing to find any push button pads to automatically open the door for me i struggled with the door until customer leaving came to help. once inside the shop there was 3 cashiers in the shop one serving the lady who helped me with the door one in the office with the door open so i could see her and one sitting watching me struggle. Brilliant isnt it. I waited for about 40-50secs to be called and served while the two counter cashiers finished thier chit chat about that nights dinner plans. The cashier didnt even call me she just stood there looking at me at which point i looked at her and her colleague and asked if they had finished sorting thier dinner arrangements. There was no response so i went over and ask why the pay at the pump only pumps were not marked as such or were they temporarily not accepting cash if not why is there no sign noticable to the customers. After about a 2-3 min discussion on which pumps they were the cashier in the office got up and joined the conversation  by which point other customers were coming in to pay. The other cashier at the till had no interest in serving the customers waiting she stood and listened into the conversation i was having with my cashier and office lady. The queueing customers were starting to get a bit restless at not being served. once we assertained which pumps i was referring to she oh there are signs up and should be on all four of those pumps as they are all pay at the pump only. then office lady says oh the two rear ones are sign posted GET THIS! JUST UNDER THE ROOF  because thats exactly where all motorists look for a sign when they are watching traffic and other vehicles straight ahead of them. and those signs only cover the two rear pumps not the front two but i am supposed to know that the signs out of my line of vision under the roof are for all four pumps. I explained to the cashier that the signs need to be more prominant and explain which pumps they refer to. Not a single word out the cashier  she took my money  and gave me a receipt. No thank you  no apology  no explanation nothing  not even a single word to say we offer disabled assistance and this is how you could access the service. that would have been my next question had she not have been so ignorant. by which point i just gave up and didnt even bother. resulting to the fact i would rather pay through the nose at texaco than use Tesco s again. Once i paid and went to leave the shop that was another challenge in itself. Granted its not a big shop. Its wide enough for shelves against the wall with a single que of people then a center isle of shelves with another que of people then shelving against the other wall. When people come into the shop they dont form queue s either side of the center shelving its not big enough and people wont get out out. so you come in form a single queue approach the counter pay and leave by the other side of the shelving. It keeps things flowing as its not possible to try and get back through the queue of people to get out. Bloody brilliant idea in principle. paid for my fuel managed to turn around to try and get out. on the left against the wall is a massive hot drinks station which wouldnt have posed a problem had the staff not stuck 4 large  heavy boxes on the floor right opposite the drinks station that sticks out a little too far. i tried to shift them out the way to the side so i had enough space to get my chair through  but i got stuck  so when i eventually got myself free and turned around the cashier that served me is standing watching me  not at any point did she offer to come and help or shift the boxes over a bit  and office lady was back in her office but still she didnt shout someone to assist me like office lady if the cashier was still serving. The whole shop of queing people then had to move to the side and out of the way so i could get through with my chair  all because someone thought they would stack some boxes right opposite an object that protruded into the ailse thus shortening the space for me to get my chair through. well done  very well thought out. Brilliant idea  it was wide enough for an able bodied person to walk past so thats ok  that will be fine no problem leaving boxes stacked up narrowing the gap as long as someone can walk past it. well done ü§£üëçüëåüëè.As most of the customers had to move to let me back out the way i came in some waited outside the shop or by the door so the door was already open and at least i didnt have to struggle with it on they way out. Excellent service  top class. truly a customer focused company! And that ladies and gentleman since my ex husband transfered out of that tesco store and back to scotland in 09 is why i never use tesco s.

I wanted to say how ridiculous its been trying to get action from Tesco over a giftcard purchased over a month ago.  Purchased on 1st November it arrived a few days later. When i tried to use it  it showed that no money had been loaded and it hadn t been activated even though it was bought from tesco and paid for online. Around 8 -10 phone calls over the following month led to nothing. Firstly promised it would be looked into. Then promised it would be manually loaded. Then when that didn t happen  a new card would be sent out. that was weeks ago. When i called this week the paperwork was still sitting on someones desk. three more calls until i finally spoke to a lovely woman who hopefully has sorted it. Going down to the office herself i am now today told it has been posted. No real official apology only one from the poor woman on the helpline. No acknowledgement of the stress and the fact that a month has passed. or the cost of the amount of telephone calls i had to make to repeat the same thing over and over again. I m told its now in the post. That remains to be seen. I doubt it very much.

It s not about making healthy choices because you ve just taken that from everyone who shops with you guys. However I m sure you know all of this!   Also not everyone can get to other stores to get alternate products that aren t sugar free so online shopping is the only way  again another right taken away from people. Suppose we could just change our online shop to Asda who sell a wider variety of products with sugar!   I m sure you are losing customers! Sort it out please! some of us only have a Tesco near so the issue of convenience comes up as not everyone has time to shop around in multiple stores!  Bring back full sugar drinks!

I ve just been to Tesco in Chester (the one off Sealand rd). I was about to pay and boom  a power cut. It came back on just as quickly  but the result was lots of beeping and bewildered tills  customers and staff. However  the duty mangaer type person was quick into action. Directing staff and customers. The main tills were still a bit unsure on what to do with themselves  but the self serve ones seemed to have bounced back. The manager said I d have to scan my shopping again. As an apology for the inconvenience I could have my tin of roses  humongous bag of pasta and the screen wash (which is all I  actually went in for!) for free. A staff member did all the scanning and packing and continuously apologised. Which was lovely considering it was a power cut and not exactly Tescos fault. So from someone who has complained numerous times to Tesco in the past  it is nice to be passing on a compliment to you and the staff team in Sealand Rd.  And thank you for the chocs  which I can now eat (and not gift) as they were freeeeee!!!

A summary of my messages to Tesco regarding their sale of a faulty TV to me during black Friday 2016.  - Complained about TV being broken upon first opening and start up.  - Offered replacement and pick up of old TV which I gratefully accepted. Then after arrangements had been made  Tesco changed their mind a few hours later.  - Offered a refund but was told TV would not be replaced. No offer of a repair (even though it s a brand new TV). Would not say why at first  then told it was out of stock. Consumer rights act 2015  states if a product is not fit for purpose then a replacement or repair  at the expense of the company who sold the product  must be offered.   - A few hours later  after further trying to resolve the problem with Tesco  they told me Tesco had discontinued selling the TV product (05/12/16).  - TV was still available to buy (now at an increased price at which I paid  ¬£399) on the Tesco website. (After being told it was discontinued). Even though I was told it was out of stock (05/12/16) and then told it was discontinued  I was able to place an order for the exact same model TV as a new customer with no problems. Videos/screenshots taken as proof with times and date. (Had previously asked  after being told it was out of stock  for a change to be made to website to show it was out of stock)  over 5 hours later  no change had been made.  - Furniture ombudsman contacted after trying to resolve the matter with Tesco failed.  - Trading standards to be notified  along with a letter and message to Tescos  CEO  containing the full transcript of conversation.  Extremely disappointed with Tesco that we could not come to an agreement and that this matter had to be taken further. Will provide constant daily feedback updates via Facebook and twitter social media to help any other people in a similar situation.

EVERYONE PLEASE BE AWARE The toy offer isn t always what it appears to be. Even though the items says it s part of the 3 for 2  it doesn t necessarily mean it is  even though its pictured with the logo. You won t find this out until you check out  so if you ve bought a few items  you might not notice. If an item is out of stock in Tesco   it ll be outsourced to a third party and will not be included in the offer. False advertising if you ask me!

A Glowing Testimonial.  I bought some freshwater prawns from Tesco in Ellesmere at the end of last week. Very tasty with a home-made Marie Rose sauce and some Little Gem lettuce. Hi  I m currently on the phone to your customer service team and I m just so disappointed. We bought a bike for our son s Christmas present in September. We got the bike and put it in the loft  upon attempting to set it up last night we discovered the chain guard and the stabilisers are shattered. The bike is now out of stock on your website and your only options are that you collect the bike  we pay for a new one and then we get the refund within 5 working days. I don t have the money to pay for a present I have already bought  it s the second week of December. Or that we wait for the refund but you can t guarantee that the bike is in stock. All we asked for is that you send a replacement as you pick up the broken bike  and that we get the refund for the difference.I am tears  I worked very hard to buy my son a present to find it broken  and then find you no help at all. This is not the first issue we ve had with broken Tesco direct items and we have always been patient. I ve cancelled our weekly shop with you  and I m afraid if we don t get a satisfactory response we ll take all of our custom elsewhere- as a 4 year old boy who wrote to Father Christmas asking for a monster bike currently isn t getting one  and you really don t seem to care.

Fuming is all I can possibly say. Ordered click and collect this morning (would have been delivery had there been ANY available slots) go to pick my shopping up in the earliest slot 4pm-6pm and find that there are substitutes.... ok so some substitutes to be expected  Rubens apples to Braeburn apples  yellow pepper to orange pepper and velvet toilet roll to Tesco own. Apples fine. Peppers fine but toilet roll quality is absolutely not the same.  Further down we have 12 bottles of water. Just water. Nothing special about it. Just plain old water.  No appropriate substitute available.  So now this evening after my children have been to school I have to drag a new born  a stroppy 12 year old and a 7 year old boy who does not cope well with supermarkets around to go and buy 12 bottles of water and apples for the lunch boxes tomorrow and yellow pepper for tea as well as toilet roll which as you know is kind of a necessity.   This defeats the point of online shopping. If I wanted to go into a supermarket I would have done so in the first place. I declined all substitutions being as the most important thing I needed was the water and no substitutions were made because apparently Tesco only sell one type of water.  Made a complaint to find a solution to the problem and have been told there is no solution.  Great service Tesco  first and last time I ll be shopping with yourselves. If you wanted to keep customers and give great service I d have a 12 pack of water on my door step before the day was out.

A little message from Amy Hearn  Hi there. I have been in contact with your support team recently regarding my daughters hudl that we bought as a Christmas present back in 2013.. we had lots of issues with it  and 2015 it was sent away and a new HUDL was given to us (after a choice of refund or exchange). After a little wait we had the HUDL back but again pretty useless- it will not charge or even turn on for her anymore...  I ve been going through the process of contacting Tesco support regarding this  when being told they would call me back it hasn t happened and leaves me having to call you again. Today it has been said after finally finding my proof of purchase that I will not be given any kind of refund or exchange as it was so long ago  despite the two facts that we had opted to have an exchange previously and the fact it s happened all over again! As a loyal customer of Tesco I m very disheartened that nothing more has been done to help us in regard to this. Tesco tiverton tech team had told me as there was so many problems with the Hudls they were discontinued and I would get a refund or exchange as the item is deemed unsafe!

For the third time now Tesco has failed to refund an item that I returned to a driver from an online grocery shop  because it was either not what I ordered  a substitution I didn t want or defective. Each time I have had to contact them a week or two later to ask them what happened to my refund. It s a waste of my time and I resent the fact that Tesco keeps customers  money until they ask for it. I am meticulous about recording my finances  so I wonder how many tens of thousands of pounds of customers  money Tesco is keeping for people who do not record or check their finances as regularly. By the way  it is the GREENFORD store/warehouse that delivers my groceries. This is in addition to generally poor customer service  including drivers being rude  failing to find my address  even though it is a cul de sac with only 5 houses or simply not turning up at all. I have continued shopping with Tesco simply because I can usually get everything I want there  which is not always the case with other supermarkets  but I m afraid that the poor customer service is losing out to the likes of Morrisons and Ocado who (so far) have provided impeccable customer service. You need to up your game Tesco if you don t want to lose even more customers. It s not enough to rely on customers contacting you to put things right - you need to find out why they are going wrong in the first place and stop them happening. I m sure I m not the only customer who is tired of having to phone you every time I place an order. If I have to phone you again  I‚Äôll be voting with my feet.

Today I went shopping in your Silverburn store and was horrified by some of the behaviour I witnessed.  You have moved any reduced items to one area and I really think you need revert this and go back to the previous arrangement of one reduced section in fruit & veg  one in meat etc. Unfortunately you cannot trust some your customers to act responsibly and today we saw two scuffles. One which involved lots of shouting  we were quite far away at the time and the entire store was filled with the noise.   The second incident happened when we were very near the reduced section when we witnessed five adult women push a child out of the way to get the newly put out reduced food. Not only did they shove a child and each other about but when they had retreated to block the aisle opposite and wait for the next lot of reduced items the left food all over the floor.   It s not safe for passers by  or your staff and it results in people blocking other shoppers movements. If you choose to keep it as it is you would need staff to ensure that behaviour does not continue to be honest I don t think you could pay your staff enough to deal with that!

So a few weeks ago I signed up for Tesco delivery saver  thinking it would be a good way to save money (I have my shopping delivered every weekend  as I have arthritis and find shopping in a supermarket really hard). Anyway today I found out that if you order under ¬£40 of food you not only get charged ¬£4 as a  minimum basket charge   but you also have to pay the delivery charge  so today I paid ¬£9.50 for only buying ¬£30 worth of food.  I think it is disgusting to charge customers TWICE for not spending over ¬£40. It s just part of our wonderful world s way of discriminating against people who are single and live alone - sometimes I don t need ¬£40 worth of food as I don t have a husband or wife or children to feed. So please charge me ¬£9.50 for the privilege. Well I had booked my Christmas slot and already have an extensive shopping list as I will be cooking for my whole family this Christmas - it s a shame sainsburys will get the business and not you because of the appalling way you treat your regular customers.

Just visited your mutton Lane store and although I have previously had very good experiences with the staff at this branch  this evening was an exception to that.  I had done my shopping with my 2 year old daughter who is poorly with a cough and I had an order to collect so I waited by the customer service desk to collect it. The lady there was having a conversation with another customer and could clearly see me standing there holding my daughter. I stood there waiting for 10 minutes  the lady (in a red t-shirt I didn t get her name) totally ignored me and began serving the customers at the tabbocco tills. I wondered why she was being so rude  the security person was also there and could see me waiting but no one said anything to me. Finally after almost 15 minutes she asked me if I was waiting for something  I think it was quite clear that I was. She then informed me that I had to wait in the queue for the tobacco counter until I could be served. I asked her why she had left me standing there for so long before she told me this and she ignored me. I was obviously quite cross about the situation and I called her and idiot which I completely understand was wrong of me. How can your customer service team be so unhelpful? I was clearly waiting to see someone and holding my heavy two year old so I really can t understand why no one spoke to me about why I was standing there for so long. Really bad service from this lady and it s a shame as the rest of the team at that store are always very friendly and helpful  what a letdown to your brand and values.

So  last weekend I bought some of your Christmas nuts. You know  the ones you crack. Got home  all ready to get festive and enjoy them in front of the TV (would be an open fire  but we haven t got one) and  to our absolute shock  horror and devastation  we found we didn t have a nut cracker! How could we be so irresponsible? Who buys a bag of nuts without access to a nutcracker?   Anyway  over the next few days  I scour the shelves of every shop I enter. Not one had a nutcracker. Now  we do live in a small town so it s to be expected. We only really have charity shops and hairdressers here. We do  however  have a Sainsburys. They ll have one... Nope! I wasn t too much more disheartened at this point  I was going to our nearest big town on Friday  I would find one there.   Nope! I won t name every shop I tried  but I will say  there are some big names in that list  and not one had a nutcracker.   I was with my Mum  she could sense the devastation in her little (30 year old) girls eyes.  It s ok  she said  I ve got to run into Tesco  they ll have one . She put her arm around my shoulder  and lead the way. (The arm around the shoulder bit may or may not be strictly true)   We walked in to the very shop I d bought the nuts from  your Ashford  Park Farm store. We went down the kitchen accessories aisle. Nothing.  it s ok  she said again   they ll be where the nuts are . Nothing. We headed back to the kitchen aisle for one last look. Definitely not there. She went up to the nearest member of staff she could find. His name was Nick and he came over to have a look with us. A third pair of eyes could not seek out the nutcracker so he had a look on the app on his trusty smart phone. Nothing. Determined there MUST be some somewhere (I mean  you ARE Tesco) he went off in search of one and told us he d come and find us and let us know of his findings. He told us that they are usually on a  clip strip  so we knew what we were looking for.   A few minutes later  he found us. He was very apologetic and told us he couldn t find any. At that point  all of the festiveness in my bones drained away. I was never going to have my nuts.    it s ok   mum said   they have little packs down the nut aisle  they have a nutcracker in them  I ll get you one of them . So  she did  I finally had my nutcracker. Plus  extra nuts  bonus! That was yesterday.   Fast forward to today  I m back in Tesco doing the weekly shop. I m checking out the beef joints on display (half price  great offer!) when I see a jolly man in a Christmas jumper approaching me.    Nutcrackers  he said. It was Nick  the friendly nutcracker hunter from the day before. I smiled.  I found them  he said.  I ve put them on display. By the time I d found them and come to find you yesterday  you d gone .   All at once  the festiveness returned. He had continued his search after telling us he couldn t find any  and even tried to find us when he had. He remembered that and recognised me and stopped the conversation he was having with his colleague to come and tell me.   What an absolute super star!!   I cannot tell you how amazed I was to receive that service. It may seem trivial to some but you don t ever see that sort of service nowadays  especially with the big companies  and on a rammo Saturday in December.   I spent the rest of my shop with a smile on my face and very happy that it seemed important enough to Nick to carry on the search and then tell me the following day.   Could you please pass on my thanks to Nick and also  give him a nice fat Christmas bonus  some Roses (Cadbury  to say thank you very much) and a free day off.   Sorry for the ramble üòè but I think it s important for you to know that you have an amazing staff member in Nick and he s restored my festive cheer!   Merry Christmas!!

When I explained this to your customer service representative he just apologised and suggested I call into my local store to see if they are on stock.  The main superstore is across town so I telephoned to check stock only to hear an automated message stating that they cannot check stock levels.  I have experienced good customer service from Tesco in the past but this has certainly put me off purchasing online goods from you in the future. Kind Regards  Claire Betteridge.

Good evening.  I wanted to write on here to publicly say a huge THANKYOU to your staff members at Tesco Addlestone (Station Road  Addlestone  KT15)  I am a committee member at my daughters charity funded pre school. I have spent the last week or so desperately trying to find donations for our Christmas fair after our main source of donations backed out with less than a week until the fair  we had literally nothing. I think in total this week alone I have been to at least 30 shops asking if they could help us out  I had up until Wednesday one donation of some mince pies ! On Tuesday I spoke to a staff member in your addlestone store to see if it was something they could do  to donate anything. I was told that sadly the lady I needed  called Jane wasn t in. I explained the position I was in and the fact it was for a pre school and a staff member actually went and called the lady on her day off. It just so happened she was actually in the store shopping. The lady didn t think twice and came and took my school letter and said there would be a gift card waiting for me Thursday morning and that I could either use it to buy prizes or use it as a prize. I was so grateful to finally have someone help. Up until then the reception I had had from other companies was disgusting and downright rude. It was so nice to find someone helpful which was still prepared to do what they could even on a day off.  Thursday came and I collected my voucher. Myself and the school secretary agreed it was best to use the voucher to get a few smellie sets and toys for prizes. So I went upstairs with my voucher and went hunting for bargains. Upstairs I saw a gentleman reducing a few toys. I cheekily asked if he was reducing anything else  explained my story again and how I had been going from shop to shop all week asking for help and just being turned away. I was literally ready to give up. The gentleman said to me  go and do some shopping or get a cup of tea  you ll have to give me half an hour and I ll see what I can do . I went with my daughter and we had a drink in the cafe and sure enough half hour later we were found by a man carrying a bundle of reduced items for us. It had electrical items  toys   headphones  computer games  I was speechless. So much so that I had to do my best not to cry. Then as if that wasn t enough he went off and came back with a coffee maker.  When I got back to my car I sat and cried. I ve been spoken to like rubbish  ignored and borderline shooed out of other shops this week  some of them well known companies. But the kindness and generosity of one store completely made up for it and we were able to fill our raffle with good prizes and it meant I didn t need to spend the gift voucher either.  I honestly can t say thankyou enough to Jane and Mark (I believe was the electrical manager) for everything they did. To help on a day off and to run round finding things I could have and coming to find me in the he store with prizes was above and beyond what I should imagine is their job. I have been a loyal customer at your Tesco Extra Main Large store in Leyland for coming up to 15yrs and have always appreciated the excellent customer service that you offer. Yet today 2nd December 2016 at 4:30pm I had a very unpleasant experience at your store that has shaken my belief in your ability to provide customer care at all times.  After a day out doing Christmas shopping with my son we needed to call into the store to pick up some wrapping paper and bits of food etc for my son as it was the only available time he would have to do this  being back in work the next day within the hospitality business. My daughter who attends Runshaw college had forgotten her keys and phoned to find out where I was so I suggested she met me and my son in the store to pick them up as her father was picking her up at 5:30 for the weekend and she needed to get her clothes etc ready..  After putting the bits that we needed into the trolley   including three bottles of larger and three bottles of cider for my son to take home with him we went to try and find till that was free. There were only a few cashier operating and the store was busy so my sun decided to use the self check out service. We put the food through the till and obviously with alcohol the staff need to check id etc which I appreciate‚Ä¶Me being 49 It wasn‚Äôt needed but my son is 25 and had id with him. He was then told that as my daughter was stood with us he was NOT allowed to purchase the alcohol because it was ‚ÄòAgainst the Law‚Äô and was asked to take them off his bill.   I explained that I was well known in the store and shop there most days and most of the shop workers know me  not only from shopping but I also feed the homeless in the local area and get some very much appreciated donations from Tesco. Also it was Not a Law or an Act if the person purchasing the alcohol had valid id. The staff member then said that it was Tesco Law and policy and it was not going to be allowed also mentioning that she couldn‚Äôt use her common sense in this issue as they were not allowed to at Tesco?  Not only was I deeply embarrassed by this situation as it was at a busy time and people were watching but we were 100% innocent in our purchase yet were made to feel extremely uncomfortable. I understand that there is a big issue with under age drinkers and I absolutely stand by the fact that it has to be stopped but in this incident I feel the store was completely out of order. Yet I was told that it was the ‚Äòlaw‚Äô that if an underage child was with an adult and they are purchasing alcohol it is NOT allowed. I wonder how many families come through your stores each day with children under the age of 18 doing their weekly shop with wine and beer etc in their shopping trolley. If what I was told was the Law then I have to say ALL these people must have their alcohol removed from their shopping as we were made to this afternoon?  We were abiding by the law and had id and were both over the age of 18..especially me!!! If you are to have standards in your store they have to be fair and they have to be followed through with EVERYONE who shops in any of your stores.   I am a decent parent and do NOT allow my daughter to drink alcohol nor does her father yet we were persecuted for no reason what so ever and made a complete mockery out of. It ruined what had been a very nice day with my hard working son who I see very little of at the best of times.  Rules are there to abide by but you have to allow your staff to use common sense and also to judge a situation in the appropriate way.   My son asked as my daughter had gone to meet her dad if he could then come back and purchase what HE needed and was told categorically NO!!!! He is nearly 26 yrs old with id and again I say I am 49 and as it stands we were pretty much told tonight we can not purchase alcohol from Tesco???? I went to the smaller Tesco on Canberra road where I know the manager well and told him and to say he was shocked was an understatement as he knows the sort of person I am and they also help me with the homeless donations. This small Tesco is a credit to your store and the staff have always been absolutely lovely with everyone who goes in  its just a shame the main store in Leyland has let your company down.   Legally we were completely entitled to purchase the items required and it is NOT against the law if you are over 18 and can prove it. I would like to think that this isn t going to happen to any other decent hard working people again and maybe a bit of training in this matter may be required because obviously they were completely out of order and had no idea what the Law  and Acts regarding underage drinking are!   As a long term customer I will now reconsider shopping at this store due to the embarrassment caused by the scene that was made when I asked to speak with the store manager. I was told no one was available. Well it‚Äôs the general public who buy the produce that pay YOUR wages so a bit of compassionate customer service would have been expected and appreciated.  Regards  L. Meg

I am writing this in regards to a recent online purchase. In the Black Friday sales I ordered an Amazon fire tablet bundle which came with with a case and a memory card for ¬£49.99. I paid for this purchase on 25/11/2016 and it was meant to be delivered with my grocery shopping today.  When the Tesco delivery driver arrived with my food shopping he informed me that my order had been cancelled or damaged he didn t know which one it was.  I rang customer services to find out what was going on and they informed me that my product arrived in my store (bradley stoke  Bristol) on the 28/11/2016 and was checked by the staff and product was fine. But today 01/12/2016 at 11.22am it was found to be damaged. Whilst speaking to the customer service team they promised me that when my item came back into stock (as it is now out of stock) I could have my item delivered but they couldn t tell me when that would be. I rang back 30 mins later and I was informed that I was now getting a refund which I hadn t asked for and that I would have to pay again when my item came back into stock. I then asked if I could have the items separately and obviously get it for the price I originally paid. They informed me that I could do that but I would have to pay an extra ¬£69.72 to get the items and then they would refund me the difference. I can ill afford to do this especially so close to Christmas and bills coming out. I am shocked at the level of incompetence of your staff who have clearly somehow damaged my purchase whilst in their care. I am also clearly angry at the lack of communication I have received. I am also upset and confused as to why I would have to pay the extra money when I haven t received the money I originally paid back into my account.   Nobody seems to know what is going on and the level of customer service is shocking. Considering I pay for your delivery saver and spend the amount I do with your company monthly. My purchase was meant to be my 9 year old sons main Christmas present so I have now had to go to Amazon directly to the items in order to make sure my son gets his present. No offer of compensation for all this suffering has been made. I am seriously considering shopping elsewhere from now on. I thought your motto was every little helps  nobody has helped me at all in this matter.

Just bought some cans of Coke and I see that the multipack has been reduced to ¬£2.50 and that you have posters up to let us know that this is a big saving - remind me again  when did they go up to the higher price that you are comparing them to? I seem to remember that they were ¬£2.50 until very recently.  Isn t this just another example of Tesco raising prices on something so that you can bring it back down to the same price and then claim a reduction? As a company you do that ALL the time and your customers know fine well that you do it all the time - what we really want is stable prices (fairly low but not at the expense of giving your staff a decent wage!)  Tesco has only just started to regain some of the customers it lost to Aldi and Lidl and when that great exodus occurred many analysts put it down to the lack of honest price transparency in Tesco (where prices go up and down all the time and where they get put up to crazy prices for a few weeks so that you can claim they have been reduced). Continuing to do this rather annoying business practice  which may keep within our rather weak laws  comes across to many of your customers (including me) as a rather awful business practice.
